text:
Justice means ending the absurdity of:

- CEOs making over 300 times as much as their average workers
- 20 percent of our children living in poverty
- life expectancy decreasing for a third year in a row
- 30 million Americans without health insurance
author: BernieSanders

text: Justice means doing everything we can to end the growing tribalism and religious bigotry we are seeing in this country and around the world. We are not going to allow Trump to divide us up.
author: BernieSanders

text: San Diego is ready for a political revolution! Join us on the first stop of our California tour:
author: BernieSanders

text: As Donald Trump said, “Let it come out." I call on the Trump administration to make Special Counsel Mueller's full report public as soon as possible. No one, including the president, is above the law.
author: BernieSanders

text: Selene has been released, but the fight is not over! She will be fighting her deportation in the upcoming months. It makes no sense to deport Dreamers like Selene from the only country they have known as home. We must stand with our immigrant sisters and brothers.
author: BernieSanders

text: We need to invest in jobs and education for our kids, not more jails and incarceration. We need to end the destructive "war on drugs," eliminate private prisons and cash bail and bring about major police department reform.
author: BernieSanders

text: The goal of a health care system cannot be to line the pockets of executives. It must be to guarantee high quality care to all, regardless of ability to pay.
author: BernieSanders

text: We're going to provide legal status for the young people eligible for the DACA program, and develop a humane policy for those who seek asylum. No more snatching babies from the arms of their parents.
author: BernieSanders

text: Our campaign will offset all carbon emissions produced from travel activities and events by investing in renewable energy and carbon reduction projects. As a nation, our goal must ultimately be to transition away from fossil fuels to 100% renewable energy.
author: BernieSanders

text: For every one billionaire in America there are about 70,000 people living in poverty. I don't think it's a radical idea to say that we should make sure our people's basic human rights are met before giving tax breaks to the richest 1%.
author: BernieSanders

text: La hija de @amy4thepeople murió porque no pudo probar que tenía seguro médico. Nuestro sistema de atención de salud disfuncional está destruyendo a las familias todos los días en todo el país. Necesitamos Medicare para todos.
author: BernieSanders

text: Under President Trump, the very concept of democracy is under attack by a president who seems intent on emulating authoritarian leaders.
author: BernieSanders

text:
A few years ago we were told that a $15 an hour minimum wage was too radical.

Soon Maryland could become the SIXTH state to pass a $15 minimum wage. Not so radical anymore. This is a national movement.
author: BernieSanders

text: Medicaid expansion has saved lives across the country. Every state must expand Medicaid as we work to make health care a right through a Medicare-for-all, single-payer system. Congratulations to the Kansas House for this major step.
author: BernieSanders

text: Candidate Trump promised to protect Social Security, Medicare and Medicaid. President Trump introduced a budget that slashes all three.
author: BernieSanders

text: This is what real action to stop gun violence looks like. We must follow New Zealand's lead, take on the NRA and ban the sale and distribution of assault weapons in the United States.
author: BernieSanders

text: No, Mr. Wheeler. Look at the devastating flooding in Nebraska, or the damage of the wildfires in California, and countless other climate-fueled disasters happening all around us right now. We must take bold action to stop climate change from getting even worse.
author: BernieSanders

text: Sen. John McCain was a friend and a man of great courage and integrity. We need a president who will fight for our veterans, not attack the memory of an American hero.
author: BernieSanders

text: Amazon. Netflix. GM. What do they all have in common? They pay nothing in federal income taxes.
author: BernieSanders

text: Real criminal justice reform means standing up to the prison industrial complex. When we are in the White House, we're going to end the disgraceful practice of profiteering from locking people up. No more private prisons and detention centers.
author: BernieSanders

text: Today marks 16 years since the United States invaded Iraq. I opposed it at the time and we are still dealing with its consequences. Our foreign policy must change.
author: BernieSanders

text: I stand with @UPTECWA and @AFSCME workers at the University of California who are striking to protect their jobs, pensions and benefits and fighting privatization.
author: BernieSanders

text:
In our health care system today you can:
 Have insurance
 Pay your premium
 Go to an in-network hospital
 Still get charged with a $100,000+ bill

Under Medicare for all that ends. We cannot afford to wait any longer to make health care a right.
author: BernieSanders

text: .@realDonaldTrump, take note. The American people will no longer tolerate a government which only works for the billionaires and massive corporations. We are going to defeat you and create a government that works for all.
author: BernieSanders

text: In the 16 years since the Iraq war began, we've lost many thousands of American and Iraqi lives and spent trillions of dollars. I opposed the war and it gives me no pleasure to say that much of what I feared came true. Our foreign policy must focus on diplomacy, not endless war.
author: BernieSanders

text: If Tennessee, a so-called "red state," can make community colleges tuition-free and their flagship university free for low-income students, there is no reason that every state in America cannot do the same and move to make public colleges tuition-free.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Trump wants to eliminate 29 programs in the Education Department, after giving $1.5 trillion in tax breaks to the rich and corporations and proposing an $860 billion increase in defense spending.

His priorities are not the priorities of the American people.
author: BernieSanders

text:
What's really bad for Americans' health is our current dysfunctional system where people die because they can't afford health care. Trump wants to make a bad situation even worse.

Medicare for All would make health care a right and save the American people trillions of dollars.
author: BernieSanders

text:
A medicine that cost $400 in 2006 is now, on average, more than $1,200.

We have got to end the greed of the pharmaceutical industry which is killing Americans.

We should allow Medicare to negotiate drug prices and let Americans import safe, affordable medicine from Canada.
author: BernieSanders

text: Amy's daughter died because she couldn't prove that she had health insurance. Our dysfunctional health care system is tearing families apart every day across this country. We need Medicare for All.
author: BernieSanders

text: We cannot allow Donald Trump to expand drilling off the Atlantic coast — and we cannot allow his pathological lying to distract us from the fight against climate change.
author: BernieSanders

text: Fracking pollutes water, degrades air quality and worsens climate change. When we are in the White House we are going to ban fracking nationwide and rapidly move to renewable energy. Thank you @ORHouseDems for taking this important step to stop fracking.
author: BernieSanders

text: The horrors of slavery still impact African-Americans today and they must be addressed. There is still redlining and still racism in lending. There is racism in the job market. We must fight institutional racism in every part of American society.
author: BernieSanders

text:
I'm excited to announce we are headed to California this weekend to bring the political revolution to the West Coast. RSVP below if you plan to join us!

San Diego 3/22: https://act.berniesanders.com/signup/event_190322_san_diego/ …
Los Angeles 3/23: https://act.berniesanders.com/signup/event_190323_los_angeles/ …
San Francisco 3/24: https://act.berniesanders.com/signup/event_190324_san_fran/ …
author: BernieSanders

text: "I don't care when 45 calls him 'Crazy Bernie'... Bernie went to Disneyland and literally said that he did not think that Mickey Mouse and Goofy approved of Disney not paying their workers a living wage. You gotta be a little crazy to do that." -@shaunking
author: BernieSanders

text: In the wealthiest country in the history of the world we can provide a decent standard of living for all of our people. That's not utopian dreaming. That is a reality.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Trump in 2015:
"I was the first & only potential GOP candidate to state there will be no cuts to Social Security, Medicare & Medicaid."

Trump's proposed budget:
-Cuts Social Security by $25 billion
-Cuts Medicare by $845 billion
-Cuts Medicaid by nearly $1.5 trillion
author: BernieSanders

text: What I mean by democratic socialism is that I want a vibrant democracy. Trump is actively involved in voter suppression and trying to keep people of color or low-income people from voting. I want to make it easier to vote.
author: BernieSanders

text: Unlike Trump, I did not come from a family that gave me a $200,000 allowance every single year starting at the age of 3. As I recall, my allowance was 25 cents a week.
author: BernieSanders

text: Our campaign is about fundamentally ending the disparity of wealth, income and power in this country. But as we do that, we must also address the disparity within the disparity—the outrageous levels of racial disparity that currently exist.
author: BernieSanders

text:
As I said in Henderson yesterday: to stop climate change, the U.S. must lead the world in transforming our energy system away from fossil fuels to sustainable energy. 

I'm glad to see @GovSisolak & @NVDems adding Nevada to the @USClimate Alliance.
author: BernieSanders

text: Powerful special interests may have the money. But we have the people. Join us live in Nevada:
author: BernieSanders

text: I applaud this bipartisan effort to prevent never-ending wars. Our bipartisan initiative to halt the war in Yemen is one part of this critical effort to create a better foreign policy.
author: BernieSanders

text: Republicans in states all over America have been trying to prevent people from voting. This is unacceptable. We must make voting easier. I urge Iowa lawmakers to reject this bill.
author: BernieSanders

text: Indebted to the pastors of Charleston, South Carolina, with whom we met yesterday. We are going to build a campaign and a nation that is built on love and justice and we will not allow any force to divide us.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Seniors cannot live in dignity trying to survive on $13,000 or $14,000 a year in Social Security benefits. 

Donald Trump wants to cut Social Security, but we have some bad news for him. We're not going to cut Social Security benefits. We're going to expand them.
author: BernieSanders

text: Throughout Nebraska and the Midwest, our friends are dealing with the worst flooding in half a century. We must provide immediate help to those suffering. Long-term, we must take bold steps to stop climate change, which makes extreme flooding much worse.
author: BernieSanders

text:
I’m proud that our campaign is the first presidential campaign to unionize. 

We cannot just support unions with words, we must back it up with actions. On this campaign and when we are in the White House, we are going make it easier for people to join unions, not harder.
author: BernieSanders

text: We will no longer accept a situation in which the top 25 hedge fund managers on Wall Street make nearly double what 140,000 kindergarten teachers in America earn and millions of kids go to over-crowded and under-funded schools.
author: BernieSanders

text:
The inventors of insulin sold its patent for $1. Eli Lilly now charges $360 a month for the drug and made $3.2 billion in profits last year.

Meanwhile, Americans must sell all their possessions to get the insulin they need.

We’re going to take on the greed of the drug industry.
author: BernieSanders

text: Health care is a right, not a privilege. We need Medicare for All.
author: BernieSanders

text: It is not a radical idea to say that people ought to have clean drinking water when they turn on their taps. Today we say to the American people that we will rebuild our crumbling infrastructure.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must build an international movement to take on the fossil fuel industry and leave a planet that is healthy and habitable for future generations. Today the young people of the #YouthClimateStrike are leading the way. Thank you for your courage.
author: BernieSanders

text: Our thoughts are with the victims of the horrific attack in Christchurch, New Zealand. No one should have to fear for their life because of their religion. We must come together to condemn all forms of hate and violence to build a future of respect and understanding.
author: BernieSanders

text: Our job: defeat Trump and create a government that works for all. Join us live in South Carolina!
author: BernieSanders

text: I do not want our children and grandchildren to look back on our actions today and ask why we didn't do everything we could to address climate change. We must stand up to the fossil fuel industry and pass a Green New Deal.
author: BernieSanders

text: Congratulations to @SteveFenberg and @COSenDem for standing up to the fossil fuel lobbyists and taking an important step to empower communities to protect their residents’ health, safety and environment.
author: BernieSanders

text: Young people are leading the way and Congress must listen. Our job: take on the NRA, expand background checks, end the gun show loophole and ban the sale and distribution of assault weapons. Congratulations to the students speaking out today.
author: BernieSanders

text: Last year Amazon raised its minimum wage to $15 an hour. Now, so has Costco. When will @Walmart, owned by the wealthiest family in America, finally start paying its workers a living wage?
author: BernieSanders

text: Today the Senate took back its constitutional responsibility to authorize war—an authority that belongs to Congress alone, not the president—by moving to end the catastrophic war in Yemen. This is an historic day.
author: BernieSanders

text: I'm running for president because we can no longer tolerate a situation where the rich get the medical attention they need in order to stay alive, while members of working-class families have to die, needlessly suffer or go hopelessly into debt to get the care they need.
author: BernieSanders

text: How can we call this a civilized society when some Americans have access to the best medical care in the world and others are unable to walk into a doctor’s office because they lack money?
author: BernieSanders

text: It is Congress who decides if and when the U.S. goes to war, not the president. For far too long Congress has abdicated that responsibility. Today that must end. Today the Senate must vote to stop supporting the Saudi-led war in Yemen, where 85,000 children have starved to death.
author: BernieSanders

text:
U.S. participation in the Saudi-led war in Yemen has not been authorized by Congress. It is unconstitutional. And it is contributing to the worst humanitarian crisis in the world.

Today the Senate must exercise its power and vote to remove the U.S. from this war in Yemen.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Today 46% of all new income goes to the top 1%. Millions of Americans are forced to work 2 or 3 jobs just to survive. Over half of our people live paycheck to paycheck. And 3 people own as much wealth as the bottom 50%.

We won't accept a rigged economy any longer.
author: BernieSanders

text:
I'm re-introducing my Medicare-for-all bill soon, and I need your help to make it clear that we're ready to fight harder than ever to guarantee health care as a right, not a privilege.

Add your name as a Citizen Co-Sponsor of Medicare-for-all:
author: BernieSanders

text: President Trump. You're not smarter than 99% of climate scientists who agree that climate change is not a hoax. It is not "fake news." It is real and will devastate millions. We are going to defeat you and move aggressively to address this crisis.
author: BernieSanders

text:
The insurance companies, drug companies and others have announced that they'll spend huge amounts of money to protect their obscene profits as they try to defeat Medicare for All.

Show them we're not backing down. Add your name to be a Citizen Co-Sponsor. https://act.berniesanders.com/signup/social_mfa_cosponsor?source=tw190312-mfa …
author: BernieSanders

text:
In a few years a $15 minimum wage has gone from a "radical idea" to being passed in:

California
Illinois
Massachusetts
New Jersey
New York
Los Angeles
Minneapolis
New York City
Seattle
San Francisco
St. Paul

We're just getting started. We will pass a federal $15 minimum wage.
author: BernieSanders

text: Our political revolution continues this week as we head to Nevada for a rally in Henderson this Saturday, March 16 at 2:30 p.m. Please RSVP here if you plan to attend. We hope to see you there!
author: BernieSanders

text: At a time when we Americans have a total of $1.5 trillion in student loan debt, it is insane that Trump’s budget would cut $207 billion from college affordability programs over 10 years and eliminate the Public Service Loan Forgiveness program.
author: BernieSanders

text: I'm excited to announce we will be heading back to South Carolina this week as we continue to grow our grassroots campaign. I hope you'll be able to join us Thursday at 7 p.m. in North Charleston. RSVP here if you plan to attend!
author: BernieSanders

text: "If Bernie Sanders in the minority in the Senate can get 350,000 Americans a raise, imagine what he will do as President of the United States." -@RoKhanna, Campaign Co-Chair
author: BernieSanders

text: At a time when climate change is already causing devastating harm, the mainstream media coverage of climate change actually decreased by 45% in 2018. That is a disgrace.
author: BernieSanders

text: Trump's weakening of the State Dept, whose budget he now wants to cut by 23%, is extremely dangerous. Our diplomats do the hard work every day of advancing US interests and security. When we are in the White House we’ll make sure they get the support they need to keep us safe.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Trump’s budget cuts $1.5 trillion from Medicaid, $845 billion from Medicare and $25 billion from Social Security.

Make no mistake about it: Trump’s budget is a massive transfer of wealth from the working class to the wealthiest people and most profitable corporations in America.
author: BernieSanders

text:
At a time when the U.S. already spends more on the military than the next 10 countries combined, Trump is proposing an $861 billion increase in base defense spending over 10 years.

For the same cost, we could make public colleges and universities tuition-free for a decade.
author: BernieSanders

text:
The big money interests have incredible wealth. They have incredible power. But at the end of the day, they are just the 1%.

We are the 99%. We have the people.
author: BernieSanders

text:
The powerful special interests who control this country are going to spend a lot of money to try to defeat us. But we have something they don’t have: the power of the people.

They understand that. When we talk about the 1%, they are 1%. We are the 99%.
author: BernieSanders

text: Donald Trump and his administration are actively involved in voter suppression. Our job is to make it easier for people to vote, not harder.
author: BernieSanders

text: Together we'll build the strongest grassroots movement in U.S. history. Join us in New Hampshire!
author: BernieSanders

text:
Our democracy is under attack by Donald Trump, who is intent on emulating authoritarian leaders in Russia, Saudi Arabia and North Korea.

There is a great struggle taking place between growing authoritarianism and democracy, and Trump is consistently on the wrong side.
author: BernieSanders

text: Democracy is about serious debate over public policy, not having a president who is a pathological liar and who has told thousands of blatant lies since he has been in office.
author: BernieSanders

text: We are back in New Hampshire to defeat Trump and to transform this country from the bottom on up.
author: BernieSanders

text: Unlike Donald Trump, I did not come from a wealthy family that built a corporate empire through housing discrimination. I grew up in a family that lived paycheck to paycheck and I protested housing discrimination.
author: BernieSanders

text: Let me say to the pharmaceutical industry: you can spend all the money you want on 30-second ads against us. You can do all the lying you want. But we are going to lower prescription drug costs in this country. You’re going to stop ripping off the American people.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Our campaign is off to an incredible start. We just finished three rallies across Iowa and are now headed to New Hampshire for two rallies.

Together, we will transform this country.
author: BernieSanders

text: When WE are in the White House, we will create a nation that leads the world in the struggle for peace and for economic, racial, social and environmental justice.
author: BernieSanders

text:
In 2017, the top 65 health care CEOs made $1.7 billion in compensation. $1.7 billion. 

Our dollars should go toward disease prevention, doctors, nurses, dentists and rural clinics—not toward making insurance companies and their CEOs super rich.
author: BernieSanders

text:
In 2015 we were told our ideas were too radical and we were polling at 3% in Iowa. 

In 2016 we won 50% of the vote in Iowa. Today, our ideas are mainstream and supported by a majority of Americans. 

Now it’s time to complete the revolution we started.
author: BernieSanders

text: We're live in Des Moines! Thank you Iowa for being a part of the revolution to transform America.
author: BernieSanders

text: Today we say to the prison-industrial-complex that we are going to bring about real criminal justice reform. We’re going to end the international embarrassment of having more people in jail than any other country on Earth.
author: BernieSanders

text: In 2016, Iowa is where the political revolution began. We're back in Iowa City to complete it.
author: BernieSanders

text:
We need policies for rural America that represent the needs of working people and farmers, not agribusiness and multinational corporations.

The time's long overdue for the U.S. government to stand with rural America and that is exactly what I will do.
author: BernieSanders

text: I applaud my House colleagues for today’s historic passage of HR1. We must repeal Citizens United, move to public funding of elections, end voter suppression and gerrymandering, and create a vibrant democracy that leads the world in voter turnout.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Today we said hello to seniors in Iowa and heard about their pressing concerns. 

We are going to lower prescription drug prices, expand Medicare to cover hearing aids, dental and vision care and expand Social Security.
author: BernieSanders

text: We cannot move forward as a nation or as a world without achieving racial, social, environmental and economic justice for women. Today we celebrate the progress that has been made on women’s rights and recommit to build a better future together. #InternationalWomensDay
author: BernieSanders

text: When workers stand together and demand that this country works for all of us rather than just the few, we can transform America. Congratulations to @ueunion Locals 506 and 618 for their successful effort in standing up for justice and dignity.
author: BernieSanders

text:
The top 10% of farms currently get 77% of all subsidies. 

The time is long overdue for the U.S. government to stand with and protect rural America.
author: BernieSanders

text: We need policies for rural America that represent the needs of working people and farmers, not agri-business and multi-national corporations.
author: BernieSanders

text:
In 2016, Iowa is where the political revolution began. Iowa, with your help on this campaign, we are going to complete what we started here. 

We're going to turn our vision and our progressive agenda into reality.
author: BernieSanders

text: We’re in Council Bluffs to kick off the first of three Iowa rallies for our historic campaign!
author: BernieSanders

text:
Today massive, profitable corporations like Amazon are paying nothing in federal income taxes and that must stop now.

You can’t be an American company only when it benefits you. You also have to be an American company when it comes to paying your fair share of taxes.
author: BernieSanders

text: .@SherrodBrown has been an ally in the fight for economic justice. Together we've fought for higher wages, tougher Wall Street regulations and a fairer trade policy. I look forward to working with him to create a government that represents all people, not just the billionaires.
author: BernieSanders

text:
The United States has:
5% of the world's population
21% of the world's prisoners.

Imagine what we could accomplish if we invested in education instead of spending $80 billion a year to lock up 2.2 million people.
author: BernieSanders

text: I stand in solidarity with activists, unions, and organizations willing to demand businesses put workers and sustainability over corporate greed and profit margins. @NYchange @MakeTheRoadNY @mpower_change @WorkingFamilies @CPDaction @RWDSU @DesisRisingUp
author: BernieSanders

text:
In the United States it costs, on average, $12,000 to have a baby.

In Finland it costs $60.

We've got to end the disgrace of our profit-driven health care system and pass Medicare for all.
author: BernieSanders

text: I did not come from a family of privilege like Trump did that prepared me to entertain people on television by telling workers: “You’re fired.” I came from a family who knew all too well the frightening power employers can have over everyday workers.
author: BernieSanders

text:
We spend more on our military than the next 10 nations combined. American troops have been in Afghanistan for nearly 18 years, Iraq since 2003 and in Syria since 2015.

We're going to invest in housing, public education and infrastructure, not never-ending wars.
author: BernieSanders

text: The ages 0-4 are the most important years of human development. The kids and parents of this country deserve quality, affordable child care. We will establish a high quality, universal pre-K program.
author: BernieSanders

text: .@JeffMerkley has been a great champion of progressive values throughout his life. We’re grateful for the work he does every day in the United States Senate and know he will continue to fight hard for the working families of Oregon and the entire country.
author: BernieSanders

text: Trump wants to divide us up by the color of our skin, our country of origin, our gender, our religion and our sexual orientation. We are going to do exactly the opposite. We are going to bring our people together for an unprecedented grassroots effort.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Tens of thousands of Americans every year get criminal records for possessing marijuana.

Meanwhile ZERO major Wall Street executives went to jail for destroying our economy in 2008 as a result of their greed, recklessness and illegal behavior.

Unacceptable.
author: BernieSanders

text: Today, black men are sentenced to 19 percent more jail time for committing the exact same crime as white men, and African Americans are jailed at more than 5 times the rate of whites. We must finally bring about real criminal justice reform in this country.
author: BernieSanders

text: If we understand that there really is no such thing as a red state or a blue state—but that we are a nation in which in every state the majority of working people are struggling hard to provide a decent life for their kids—there is nothing we cannot accomplish. #BernieInChicago
author: BernieSanders

text:
No more private prisons and detention centers. 

No more profiteering from locking people up. 

No more "war on drugs." 

No more keeping people in jail because they're too poor to afford cash bail. 

#BernieInChicago
author: BernieSanders

text: Have we made progress in civil rights in this country since the early 1960s? No question about it. Do we still have a very long way to go to end the institutional racism which permeates almost every aspect of our society? Absolutely. #BernieInChicago
author: BernieSanders

text: Whether it is the struggle is against racism, or sexism, or homophobia, or corporate greed, or environmental devastation, or war and militarism or religious bigotry—real change never takes place from the top on down. It always takes place from the bottom on up. #BernieInChicago
author: BernieSanders

text: My years here in Chicago gave me the opportunity to become involved in the civil rights movement, in the labor movement, in the peace movement and in electoral politics—experiences that significantly shaped my life. #BernieInChicago
author: BernieSanders

text: In the last decade, more than 30 states have considered voter suppression laws whose clear intent is to disenfranchise people of color. How pathetic and how cowardly is that! #BernieInChicago
author: BernieSanders

text: We will no longer accept the absurd situation where large corporations like Amazon, Netflix and General Motors pay nothing in federal income taxes after raking in billions in profits. #BernieInChicago
author: BernieSanders

text: We have begun the political revolution.  Now we’re going to complete it. #BernieInChicago
author: BernieSanders

text: We're in Chicago to launch our campaign and fight for racial and economic justice. #BernieInChicago
author: BernieSanders

text: As we mark 54 years since Bloody Sunday, it's a disgrace that we are still fighting for the right to vote. We must not only end all forms of voter suppression in this country, we must make it easier for people to vote.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you to the 13,000 people who came to Brooklyn yesterday to officially launch our campaign, the many more who followed along online, and our volunteers who made our rally possible. It was an incredible day. Let's keep the movement going.
author: BernieSanders

text: When we are in the White House, we will enact a federal jobs guarantee, to ensure that everyone is guaranteed a stable job. Between transforming our energy system and rebuilding our crumbling infrastructure, there is more than enough work to be done. Let's do it.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must preserve New York’s fusion voting system because it gives more voice to voters. I support the @WorkingFamilies Party’s efforts to protect this system, which gives voters a stronger voice in elections and in government.
author: BernieSanders

text: Our political revolution is just getting started. Help us keep the momentum going—tomorrow night, join us at Navy Pier in Chicago to kick off our nationwide movement.
author: BernieSanders

text: Powerful special interests may have the money. But we have something better. We have the people. #BernieInBrooklyn
author: BernieSanders

text:
Brothers and sisters: We have an enormous amount of work in front of us. If we stand together, if we don't allow Trump and his friends to divide us up, there is nothing we cannot accomplish.

This country has an extraordinary future. Let's make it happen.  #BernieInBrooklyn
author: BernieSanders

text: When we are in the White House, we will move aggressively to end the epidemic of gun violence in this country and pass the common sense gun safety legislation that the overwhelming majority of Americans want. #BernieInBrooklyn
author: BernieSanders

text: Over the last 2 years and before, you and I and millions of Americans have stood up and fought for justice in every part of our society. Because of all the work we have done, we are now on the brink of winning not just an election, but transforming our country. #BernieInBrooklyn
author: BernieSanders

text: Unlike Donald Trump, who shut down the government and left 800,000 federal employees without income to pay the bills, I know what it's like to be in a family that lives paycheck to paycheck. #BernieInBrooklyn
author: BernieSanders

text: My father came to this country from Poland at 17, without a nickel in his pocket. He came to escape the crushing poverty that existed in his community, and to escape widespread anti-Semitism. Virtually his entire family there was wiped out by Nazi barbarism. #BernieInBrooklyn
author: BernieSanders

text: Brothers and sisters: We're going to win this election not because we have a super PAC funded by billionaires. We're going to win this election because we are going to bring our people together for an unprecedented grassroots effort. #BernieInBrooklyn
author: BernieSanders

text: Instead of demonizing the undocumented immigrants in this country, we're going to pass comprehensive immigration reform and provide a path toward citizenship. We're going to provide legal status to the 1.8 million young people eligible for the DACA program. #BernieInBrooklyn
author: BernieSanders

text: Today, we say to Trump and the fossil fuel industry: climate change is not a hoax but is an existential threat to our country and the entire planet. All of us have a moral responsibility to leave our children and grandkids a healthy and habitable planet. #BernieInBrooklyn
author: BernieSanders

text: Today we say to the private health insurance companies, whether you like it or not, the United States will join every other major country on Earth and guarantee healthcare to all people as a right. #BernieInBrooklyn
author: BernieSanders

text: Today, I want to welcome you to a campaign which says, loudly and clearly, that the underlying principles of our government will not be greed, hatred and lies. It will not be racism, sexism, xenophobia, homophobia and religious bigotry. That is going to end. #BernieInBrooklyn
author: BernieSanders

text:
I’m back in Brooklyn, the place I was born and raised, to kick off this historic campaign.

We're going to win this election because we will put together the strongest grassroots coalition in the history of American politics. #BernieInBrooklyn
author: BernieSanders

text: We're getting ready to kick off our campaign at Brooklyn College and begin the next phase of our political revolution. #BernieInBrooklyn
author: BernieSanders

text: If you’re able to, join us in Brooklyn tomorrow. If you’re not, I hope you’ll follow along online and help us launch this historic movement. 4/4
author: BernieSanders

text: For too many, the dream of progress and opportunity is denied. With your help, we're going to win this election because we'll put together the strongest grassroots coalition in the history of American politics and create a government that works for all, not just those on top. 3/4
author: BernieSanders

text: As a kid I learned, in many, many ways, what lack of money means to a family. That’s a lesson I have never forgotten. I have seen the promise of America in my own life. My parents would have never dreamed that their son would be a U.S. senator, let alone run for president. 2/4
author: BernieSanders

text: I grew up in Brooklyn, in a three-and-a-half room, rent-controlled apartment on E. 26th St. in Midwood. Tomorrow, we kick off our presidential campaign not far from there, at Brooklyn College, where I studied for a year. 1/4
author: BernieSanders

text:
How is it that the billionaires of this country get huge tax breaks, but our teachers and children get broken chairs, flooded classrooms and inadequate support staff in their schools?

I’m running for president because we need a radical change in national priorities.
author: BernieSanders

text: If we can spend over $700 billion on our military every year we can certainly make public colleges and universities tuition-free in America.
author: BernieSanders

text:
There are 140 million poor and low-income people in this country, while the three richest people are together worth over $318 billion. 

This is the reason we fight for a government and economy that work for more than the top 1%.
author: BernieSanders

text: Clearly, Pence and Trump are afraid of our campaign because when 1 million people volunteer in a week, the president and VP know our grassroots campaign is the strongest challenge to their chances for re-election. They know our ideas are widely supported by the America people.
author: BernieSanders

text: Our political revolution is just getting started. Join us TOMORROW, March 2, at Brooklyn College for the very first rally of our campaign: https://act.berniesanders.com/signup/event-190302-brooklyn/ …
author: BernieSanders

text: What democratic socialism means to me is making sure that all people live with security and dignity. That was FDR’s vision over 70 years ago and it is what we must continue to fight for today.
author: BernieSanders

text:
I believe health care must be a right, not a privilege.

I believe we must combat climate change, save the planet and create millions of jobs.

I believe everyone in America should be able to attend college, regardless of their family’s income.

What’s radical about that?
author: BernieSanders

text: Our campaign has gotten off to an incredible start, but our nationwide movement to take on the billionaire class is just getting going. I hope you'll join us this Sunday, March 3 for a kickoff rally at Navy Pier in Chicago:
author: BernieSanders

text: On Saturday I'm going back to Brooklyn, where I was born and raised, for the first rally of our campaign. Let's show Trump and the powerful special interests what they're up against. RSVP here to join us: https://act.berniesanders.com/signup/event-190302-brooklyn/ …
author: BernieSanders

text:
Medicare for all is not some crazy idea.

It's supported by 70% of the American people.

It's co-sponsored by more than 100 members of Congress.

It's what we must do to end the international disgrace of being the only major country not to make health care a right.
author: BernieSanders

text:
We have got to get our priorities right.

Instead of giving huge tax breaks to billionaires and profitable corporations, we must create the best public educational system in the world. Instead of major increases in military spending, we must invest in our kids.
author: BernieSanders

text:
You cannot claim that a health care system in which more than 42% of cancer patients lose their life savings within 2 years is a system that works. It is a moral outrage.

We need Medicare for All, and we need it now.
author: BernieSanders

text:
1,700 Wabtec workers in Erie, PA are on strike because the company refuses to treat workers fairly, even though Wabtec will bring in $8 billion this year.

Tell CEO Raymond Betler to let workers negotiate a fair, equitable collective bargaining agreement:
author: BernieSanders

text: I'm running for president because we need real criminal justice reform. It’s an international disgrace that we have more people in jail than any other country—disproportionately Black, Latino and Native American.

text: We must follow cities and states across the country and raise the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour and index it to median wage growth thereafter. Doing so would give more than 40 million low-wage workers a raise, more than 25 percent of the U.S. workforce.

text:
In the United States, drug companies can charge whatever they want and raise prices whenever they want. That's not the case in other countries around the world. 

We've got to stop letting pharma rip off the American people.

author: BernieSanders

text:
We spend almost twice as much per capita on health care as any nation, yet our health outcomes are worse and life expectancy is in decline. How does that make any sense?

It is time for us to join every other major country and guarantee health care to all people as a right.

text: The pharmaceutical industry is the greediest entity in the country. And the way we are going to beat them is by millions of people standing up and saying, "You're not going to get away with killing Americans any longer."

Absolutely.

#SandersTownHall

text: At a time of massive income and wealth inequality, am I going to demand that the very rich and large corporations start paying their fair share in taxes? Damn right I am. #SandersTownHall

text: Where are we going to get the money to pay for our priorities? To start, Amazon made $11.2 billion in profits last year. You know how much they paid in taxes? $0. We're going to change that. #SandersTownHall

text: I hope and believe that every Democratic candidate will come together after the nominee is selected and make sure Donald Trump is not re-elected. I hope I am the nominee, but if I’m not, I certainly pledge to do that. #SandersTownHall
author: BernieSanders

text:
The only way we will defeat Trump and the special interests that support him is with a grassroots movement – the likes of which has never been seen in American history.

Let’s show the billionaire class we’re not backing down any time soon.
author: BernieSanders

text: I've been criticized for saying this so let me say it again: The federal minimum wage of $7.25 is a starvation wage and every worker in America deserves a living wage of at least $15 an hour.

text: This campaign is about talking about the issues we are fighting for. I condemn bullying and harassment of any kind and in any space.
author: BernieSanders

author: BernieSanders

text:

-Insurance companies

Who's going to win:

-We are.

text:
The U.S. has the highest incarceration rate in the world and incarcerates African Americans at more than five times the rate of white people.

Our job is to end the destructive “war on drugs,” eliminate private prisons and cash bail and bring about major police department reform.
author: BernieSanders

text:
50 years ago, the CEO-to-worker compensation ratio was 20 to 1.

Last year, it was 312 to 1.

While the middle class has been decimated and working people struggle to get by, the rich continue to get richer. Unacceptable.
author: BernieSanders

text:
"Radical." "Extreme." That's what the ideas we fought for in 2016 were considered back then.

Now those ideas are supported by a majority of Americans. It's time to defeat Donald Trump, complete that revolution and implement the vision we fought for.

They may have the money. But we have the people. We are going to win this fight.
author: BernieSanders

text: I'm running for president because we need to understand that artificial intelligence and robotics must benefit the needs of workers, not just corporate America and those who own that technology.

$25,149.

That's how much the Walton family of Walmart makes in a single MINUTE—more than the average Walmart worker makes in an entire year.

Instead of austerity for working families and the poor, we need austerity for billionaires and massive corporations.

text: My time at the University of Chicago, at the height of the Civil Rights Movement, changed my life and helped shape me into the person I am today. I'm excited to return to Chicago as we kick off our movement. Join us at Navy Pier next Sunday, March 3rd:

text: I am very excited to announce that I’ll be returning home to Brooklyn, where I spent the first 19 years of my life, for the first rally of our campaign this Saturday, March 2nd. RSVP here to join us as we kick off our nationwide movement:

text: Americans should not die without the medication they need because drug companies want to make even bigger profits. I’m running for president because we need to take on the pharmaceutical industry's outrageous greed and lower drug prices in this country.

text: Our campaign is about creating a vibrant democracy with the highest voter turnout of any major country. We must restore the Voting Rights Act, overturn Citizens United, end voter suppression and gerrymandering, make Election Day a holiday and move to public funding of elections.

-Guarantee all workers paid family and medical leave
author: BernieSanders

text:
Our campaign is based upon a very simple principle: Real change never comes from the top on down. It always comes from the bottom on up.

When millions of us stand together, there is nothing we cannot accomplish.

text: Our campaign is about creating a government and economy that work for the many, not just the few. We should not have grotesque levels of wealth inequality in which three billionaires own more wealth than the bottom half of the country.

text: In the richest nation in the history of the world, it's a moral and political failing that nearly 30 million Americans don’t have health insurance. We must go forward to finally guarantee health care for all as a right through a Medicare for All, single-payer program.

text: The Walton family makes more money in one minute than Walmart workers do in an entire year. This is what we mean when we talk about a rigged economy.

author: BernieSanders

text: There is something profoundly wrong when one family in our country, the Walton family, owns more wealth than the bottom 130 million Americans. We need an economy that works for all of us, not just the rich and powerful.
author: BernieSanders

text: A moral society does not give tax breaks to billionaires, and then cut back on the needs of struggling seniors or people with disabilities. We must get our priorities straight and expand Social Security.

text: If we are going to successfully combat climate change, we must have the courage to take on the greed of the fossil fuel industry which is driving this crisis—as well as well as the politicians who have been bought off and refuse to do anything to address it.

text: The current federal minimum wage of $7.25 an hour is a starvation wage. It must be raised to $15 an hour and indexed to median wage growth thereafter. Doing so would give more than 40 million Americans a raise.

text: When it comes to taking on the imminent threat of climate change, we cannot think small. We must enact bold solutions to save our planet from the disastrous effects of climate change by passing the Green New Deal to save the planet and create millions of new jobs.

text: We must end the international embarrassment of being the only major country on earth, the only one, which does not guarantee workers paid medical and family leave, paid sick time and paid vacation time.

text: Enough is enough. We have to summon the courage to take on the fossil fuel industry. We must accelerate our transition to clean energy, and finally put people before the profits of polluters.

text: The mark of a great nation is judged not by how many tax breaks it can give to billionaires, but by how it treats its most vulnerable people.
author: BernieSanders

author: BernieSanders

text: Nearly 85 percent of all stocks owned by Americans belong to the wealthiest 10 percent of households. The time is long overdue for us to create an economy that works for all Americans, not just the people on top.

text:
We must repeal Citizens United, move to public funding of elections and end voter suppression and gerrymandering.

Our goal: establish a political system that has the highest voter turnout in the world and is governed by the democratic principle ‘one person - one vote.’

author: BernieSanders

text: Real and fundamental change never comes from the top on down. It’s never given to anybody. It always comes from the bottom on up, from grassroots activism, from millions of people standing up and fighting for justice.
