text: Correction: more than half of older Americans have no retirement savings.
author: BernieSanders

text: We don’t need to create artificial crises like this government shutdown. We have enough real ones. Mr. President, end the crisis you created. End the shutdown.
author: BernieSanders

text: If we are serious about reducing income and wealth inequality and creating good paying jobs, we have to substantially increase the number of union jobs in this country. We must make it easier, not harder, for workers to join unions.
author: BernieSanders

text: The Sackler family and Purdue Pharma helped cause the opioid crisis through aggressive marketing and lobbying of the opioid painkiller OxyContin. We must hold the pharmaceutical companies and executives that created the opioid crisis accountable.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you to @BenedictEDU for hosting me this afternoon. Your generation has the power to transform this nation.
author: BernieSanders

text: BERNIE LIVE IN SOUTH CAROLINA: Watch Senator Sanders speak with students at Benedict College (@OfficialBenedictPage)
author: BernieSanders

text: Dr. King taught us that the “inseparable twin of racial injustice is economic injustice.” He taught us that we had to fight against three major evils – “the evil of racism, the evil of poverty and the evil of war.” #MLKDay
author: BernieSanders

text: Racial equality must be central to combatting economic inequality, if we are to build an economy that works for all of us, and not just the top 1%.
author: BernieSanders

text: In my view, not only do we have to expand primary health care and build more community health centers, but we need to guarantee health care to every man, woman and child as a right – through a Medicare for all, single-payer program.
author: BernieSanders

text: We can and must end the pollution that disproportionately poisons the poor and people of color. We must move forward towards a jobs guarantee and a Green New Deal.
author: BernieSanders

text:
In 1963, I had the honor of attending Dr. King's March on Washington for Jobs and Freedom. 

56 years after that march, many of the demands being made then are still being fought for today. 

Let’s work together and, in the spirit of Dr. King, get it done.
author: BernieSanders

text: Today we are here, not just to remember and honor Dr. King. We  are here  to fulfill his revolutionary spirit, to have the courage to take on the economic and political establishment and to create the kind of nation we know we can become.
author: BernieSanders

text: "We are here today to honor and remember Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., a man of extraordinary brilliance and courage who time and time again put his life on the line in the struggle for racial, economic and social justice." #MLKDay
author: BernieSanders

text: BERNIE LIVE IN SOUTH CAROLINA: Watch Senator Sanders speak at the annual King Day at the Dome rally in Columbia, South Carolina
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you for hosting us, @SCNAACP. #MLKDay
author: BernieSanders

text: If President Trump thinks privatizing the VA is what is best for our veterans, he is dead wrong. We must fully fund and expand the VA so that every veteran gets the care that he or she has earned and deserves.
author: BernieSanders

text:
If Trump wants to talk about crises, why don’t we look at the massive levels of income and wealth inequality. Or the 30 million Americans who have no health insurance and millions more who cannot afford the medicine they need. 

Grow up, do your job, end this shutdown.
author: BernieSanders

text: Instead of austerity programs for working families and the poor, we need austerity for billionaires and large multinational corporations. We must demand that they pay their fair share in taxes.
author: BernieSanders

text: No other country allows pharmaceutical companies to charge any price they want for any reason they want. The greed of the prescription drug industry is literally killing Americans and it has got to stop.
author: BernieSanders

text: Today, in America, more than half of older workers have no retirement savings – zero. That is unacceptable. We must create an economy that works for all of us, not just the wealthy few.
author: BernieSanders

text: What I’ve learned from the labor movement is that one worker alone can beg for a wage, decent working conditions and retirement benefits, but when people stand together they don’t have to beg. They can win what they rightfully deserve. There is power in a union.
author: BernieSanders

text: How is it that the top 25 hedge fund managers in this country make more money than the combined salaries of every kindergarten teacher? We have got to get our priorities right.
author: BernieSanders

text: At a time of massive income and wealth inequality, Trump’s policies are moving this country in exactly the wrong direction. Over 83% of the benefits of Trump’s tax plan is going to the top 1%.
author: BernieSanders

text: How is it that the billionaires of this country get huge tax breaks, but our teachers and children get broken chairs, flooded classrooms and inadequate support staff in their schools? That is what a rigged economy looks like.
author: BernieSanders

text: Let’s show the @UTLAnow teachers we stand with them in their struggle. Donate $27 today to their solidarity strike fund: https://act.berniesanders.com/signup/UTLA_strike/ …
author: BernieSanders

text: We cannot spend more on our military than the next 10 nations combined while millions of Americans go without food, housing, and health care. It’s about time we got our national priorities right.
author: BernieSanders

text: Together, we must fight for a society that works for all Americans, not just the wealthy few. We must fight for economic, social, racial and environmental justice, not unbridled greed.
author: BernieSanders

text: No, Donald Trump, the economy is not “absolutely booming” when nearly 80% of workers live paycheck to paycheck – hoping that they don’t get sick or that their car doesn’t break down.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Raising the minimum wage to $15 an hour  -->

2015:
5 cosponsors in the Senate
56 cosponsors in the House

2019:
31 cosponsors in the Senate
181 cosponsors in the House

Real change never comes from the top on down. It always begins from the bottom up.
author: BernieSanders

text: Just a few years ago, we were told that raising the minimum wage to $15 an hour was ‘radical.’ It is not a radical idea to say a job should lift you out of poverty, not keep you in it. We must increase the federal minimum wage from a starvation wage of $7.25 to $15 an hour.
author: BernieSanders

text: A job must lift workers out of poverty, not keep them in it. We must raise the federal minimum wage from a starvation wage of $7.25 an hour to $15 an hour. Doing so would directly increase the wages of more than 25 percent of the U.S. workforce.
author: BernieSanders

text: I stand in solidarity with @UTLAnow teachers who began striking today in Los Angeles for the first time in 30 years. Teaching is one of the most valuable and indispensable professions. We need to treat educators with respect and dignity. #UTLAStrong
author: BernieSanders

text: If the pharmaceutical industry will not end its greed, which is literally killing Americans, then we will end it for them.
author: BernieSanders

text:
The reality for American working families is that
-Real wages for average workers are lower than in 1973
-80% of Americans live paycheck to paycheck
-Half of older Americans have no retirement savings
We need to create an economy that works for all of us.
author: BernieSanders

text: This week I will introduce legislation along with many other members of Congress to raise the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour. Doing so would directly benefit over 41 million workers, including over half of African-American workers and nearly 60% of Latino workers.
author: BernieSanders

text: Federal lands and waters must not be opened up to fossil fuel extraction. Public lands are national treasures that should be protected for future generations, not auctioned off to the fossil fuel industry’s highest bidders.
author: BernieSanders

text: Exxon Mobil knew the truth about fossil fuels and climate change and lied to protect their business model at the expense of the planet. The greed of the fossil fuel industry must end.
author: BernieSanders

text:
To the women on my 2016 campaign who were harassed or mistreated, thank you, from the bottom of my heart, for speaking out. I apologize. 

We can't just talk about ending sexism and discrimination. It must be a reality in our daily lives. That was clearly not the case in 2016.
author: BernieSanders

text: President Trump, you want to talk about crises.  At a time of massive income and wealth inequality, tens of millions of workers in our country are earning starvation wages and are unable to adequately provide for their families.
author: BernieSanders

text: I stand in solidarity w/ @UTLAnow teachers in their fight for fair pay, smaller classroom sizes & stipends for materials and supplies. Teaching is one of the most valuable and indispensable professions. We need to treat educators with respect and dignity.
author: BernieSanders

text: Our federal employees deserve to be treated with respect, not held hostage as political pawns.
author: BernieSanders

text: This is what a rigged economy is all about. We must work to transform American society by making our political and economic systems work for all of us, not just the 1 percent.
author: BernieSanders

text: The business model of Wells Fargo and Wall Street is fraud. The time has come to break up Wells Fargo and other behemoth financial institutions. No bank should be too big to fail and no CEO should be too big to jail.
author: BernieSanders

text: In America today, a person can walk into a pharmacy and find that the medicine they have used for years has doubled, tripled, or quadrupled literally overnight. THAT is a true crisis.
author: BernieSanders

text: Mr. President, we don’t need to create artificial crises.  We have enough real ones.  Let us end this shutdown and bring the American people together around an agenda that will improve life for all of our people.
author: BernieSanders

text: President Trump, you want to talk about a national emergency? 30 million Americans have no health insurance and many more are underinsured. Thousands die each year because they don’t go to a doctor when they should.
author: BernieSanders

text: The @fightfor15 movement is making a profound impact. We must follow cities and states across the country and raise the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Arming teachers is not the answer to our country’s gun epidemic.
We should be working to:
expand background checks
end the gun show loophole
end the so-called “straw man” provision
ban the sale & distribution of assault weapons
author: BernieSanders

text: The United States of America is the only -- only -- major country on Earth that does not provide paid family and medical leave. That must change.
author: BernieSanders

text: Every American, regardless of income, should have the opportunity to get the education they need to thrive. We must move to make public colleges and universities tuition-free across the nation.
author: BernieSanders

text: If we are serious about reducing income and wealth inequality and creating good paying jobs, we have to substantially increase the number of union jobs in this country. We must make it easier, not harder, for workers to join unions.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must end the absurdity of the United States having more people in jail than any other country on Earth. We must invest in jobs and education for our young people, not more jails and incarceration.
author: BernieSanders

text: As Frederick Douglass reminded us: "If there is no struggle, there is no progress." Real change will not come unless we take on the greed of Wall Street, the drug companies, the fossil fuel industry, the NRA, the military-industrial-complex and other special interests.
author: BernieSanders

text: When we talk about justice, we have to understand that there is no justice when the top 0.1 percent -- not 1 percent, the top 0.1 percent -- today in America owns almost as much wealth as the bottom 90 percent.
author: BernieSanders

text: Jane and I want to take this opportunity to wish you and yours a very healthy and happy New Year. Let us resolve to fight like we have never fought before for a government, a society and an economy that works for all of us, not just those on top.
author: BernieSanders

text: Today, at a time of massive income and wealth inequality and an outrageous level of corporate greed, we must never forget the struggles and ideals of those who came before us. We must continue the fight for a government and an economy that works for all, and not just the few.
author: BernieSanders

text: Health care is a right. The United States must join the rest of the industrialized world and guarantee health care to every man, woman, and child through a national Medicare for all, single-payer system.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thanks to the @fightfor15 movement, millions of low-wage workers across the country will see wage increases in 2019. We must raise the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour.
author: BernieSanders

text: Enough is enough. It’s time for a political revolution that takes on the fossil fuel billionaires, accelerates our transition to clean energy, and finally puts people before the profits of polluters.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must have the courage to take on the greed and ideology of the billionaire class and to fight for a world of economic, social, racial and environmental justice. Will this be an easy struggle? Certainly not. But it is a fight that we cannot avoid. The stakes are just too high.
author: BernieSanders

text: No real change in American history—not the labor, civil rights, women’s, gay rights, environmental, nor any other movement for social justice—has ever succeeded without grassroots activism, without millions of people engaged in the struggle for justice.
author: BernieSanders

text: The American people want comprehensive immigration reform and a criminal justice system that is based on justice, not racism or mass incarceration.
author: BernieSanders

text: It is an international embarrassment that we have more people locked up in jail than any other country on earth. That has got to end. We must become the country in the world which invests in jobs and education, not in more jails and incarceration.
author: BernieSanders

text: New research shows the @FightFor15 movement to raise minimum wages directly led to a collective $68 billion raise for 22 million low-wage workers in cities and states across the country. We must raise the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour.
author: BernieSanders

text: No one should have to work 120 hours a week or 5 jobs to be able to get the health care they need. We need a health care system that puts people before profits. We need a Medicare for all, single-payer system.
author: BernieSanders

text: In 1980, CEOs made 30 times more than the average worker. Last year, the CEO-to-worker compensation ratio was 312-to-1. Together, we must finally create an America that works for all of us, not just those on top.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must rebuild the American labor movement and make it easier, not harder, for workers to join unions. We must recommit ourselves to bringing all working people together in the fight for a just and humane world.
author: BernieSanders

text: A job should lift workers out of poverty, not keep them in it. The current federal minimum wage of $7.25 an hour is a starvation wage and must be raised to $15 an hour.
author: BernieSanders

text: Health care is a right and not a privilege. It's time for a Medicare for all, single-payer system.
author: BernieSanders

text: Sears is giving its executives $25 million in bonuses after the company closed over 100 stores and laid off thousands of employees. We must create an economy that works for all of us, not just those on top.
author: BernieSanders

text: The average worker who would benefit from a $15 an hour minimum wage is more than 35 years old. The majority of low-wage workers are women – over 20 million of whom would get a raise by increasing the federal minimum wage to $15 an hour.
author: BernieSanders

text: The federal minimum wage has not been raised since 2009. Increasing the minimum wage from $7.25 to $15 an hour would directly benefit 41 million workers, including over half of African-American workers and close to 60 percent of Latino workers.
author: BernieSanders

text: Enough is enough. It’s time to substantially reduce student debt and make public colleges, universities, and vocational schools tuition free in the United States.
author: BernieSanders

text: Clean water protections are essential to safeguarding our nation’s public health and our economic prosperity. One in three people – 117 million Americans – depend on drinking water from sources protected by the Clean Water Rule.
author: BernieSanders

text: President Trump and his friends in the fossil fuel industry, in the name of short-term profits, are destroying the planet that we will be leaving our children and grandchildren.
author: BernieSanders

text: If every major country on earth can guarantee health care to all and achieve better health outcomes, while spending substantially less per capita than we do, it is absurd for anyone to suggest that the United States of America cannot do the same.
author: BernieSanders

text: A secure retirement is a central pillar of economic security for our working class. We must expand Social Security so that every American can retire with the dignity and respect they deserve.
author: BernieSanders

text: This is what we mean when we talk about a rigged economy. If Sears has $25 million to give bonuses to executives after closing over 100 stores, why is the company telling thousands of laid off employees they don't have the money to pay their severance?
author: BernieSanders

text: When we stand together, there is nothing, nothing, nothing we cannot accomplish. Together, we must reinvigorate democracy and transform our country so it works for the many, not just the few.
author: BernieSanders

text: No one can deny that today’s minimum wage of $7.25 an hour is nothing more than a starvation wage. After 10 years of inaction, it’s time to raise the minimum wage to $15 an hour. Doing so would directly benefit over 41 million workers across the nation.
author: BernieSanders

text: Yesterday was a historic day. People all across the country woke up to our role in the horrific Saudi-led intervention in Yemen. We made it clear that the U.S. must rethink our relationship with the despotic Saudi regime.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you to all the people at the grassroots level throughout our country who helped us win this major vote on the path toward ending U.S. involvement in the horrific Saudi-led intervention in Yemen.
author: BernieSanders

text: In the last three years, 85,000 children have died and millions are on the brink of starvation. We must tell Saudi Arabia that the United States will no longer support their despotic regime's role in the horrific war in Yemen.
author: BernieSanders

text: We cannot follow the lead of the despotic regime in Saudi Arabia any longer. We must end U.S. support for the disastrous Saudi-led war in Yemen today.
author: BernieSanders

text: The time is long overdue for the United States to stop following the lead of Saudi Arabia. The Senate must reassert its constitutional authority and vote today to end our support for this unauthorized, unconstitutional, and disastrous Saudi-led war in Yemen.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must extend the concept of public education beyond the 12th grade and make public colleges and universities tuition-free. Every young person, regardless of the income of his or her family, should have the opportunity to attend college.
author: BernieSanders

text: During his campaign, Trump repeatedly promised the American people that “the rich will not be gaining at all” from his tax plan and that it would provide a “big-league” tax cut for the middle class. He lied.
author: BernieSanders

text: The war in Yemen has displaced more than 3 million, brought 14 million to the brink of famine, and killed more than 16,000 civilians. The United States cannot continue supporting the disastrous Saudi-led war in this country.
author: BernieSanders

text: For every man, woman, and child in this country - regardless of income, race, gender, or zip code - health care must be recognized as a right, not a privilege.
author: BernieSanders

text: The Obama rule was designed to limit pollution in about 60 percent of the nation’s bodies of water, protecting sources of drinking water for about a third of the United States. Trump’s new rule puts the profits of polluters over the American people.
author: BernieSanders

text: After releasing a report that clearly states our need to transform our energy system away from fossil fuels and reduce carbon emissions, Trump’s EPA pick, Andrew Wheeler, is rolling back regulations that would help us accomplish just that.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Activists in Michigan collected 400,000 signatures on two separate petitions to put the minimum wage increase and paid sick leave on the ballot this November. 

Republicans' decision to undermine the will of the people is disgraceful and undemocratic.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Steps to creating a vibrant democracy:

expand voter registration
expand voter turnout
overturn Citizens United
restore the Voting Rights Act
fight gerrymandering
author: BernieSanders

text: Climate change is real, it is caused by human activity, and it is already causing devastating harm here in the United States and across the globe. The fight for the future of the planet is the fight of our lifetime.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must continue the fight to ensure that every man, woman, and child in America has access to the health care they need. We can accomplish this and so much more if we stand boldly against corporate interests for the future we believe in.
author: BernieSanders

text: U.N. officials have called the situation in Yemen the “largest food security crisis in the world.” U.S. support for the Saudi-led war in Yemen must end.
author: BernieSanders

text: What Wisconsin Republicans are doing is undemocratic, outrageous, and an unprecedented attack on the poor.
author: BernieSanders

text: The best minds in the world are telling us that we have twelve years - which is no time at all - to get our act together. If we work to rapidly transform our energy system away from fossil fuels, this country could lead the world in saving the planet.
author: BernieSanders

text: This is a moral stain on this country and Trump must be stopped from making the situation even worse. These families must be reunited immediately, and separations at the border permanently stopped.
author: BernieSanders

text:
If we work to rapidly transform our energy system away from fossil fuels, this country could lead the world in saving the planet.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/energy-environment/2018/12/05/we-are-trouble-global-carbon-emissions-reached-new-record-high/?fbclid=IwAR3H1x3J_z4REGUReJStRrdk_BO41G7c2YKpgT-SBaN6s_eKC_-Ooi3A2lo&noredirect=on&utm_term=.1c162786986a&wpisrc=al_news__alert-world--alert-national&wpmk=1 …
author: BernieSanders

text: A fight for fair wages is always a worthy fight because, in this country, one job should be enough for a person to live with dignity.
author: BernieSanders

text: We MUST work to strengthen voting rights and protections to ensure that people in every state can actively participate in our democratic process.
author: BernieSanders

text: Coal ash won’t just affect millions of Americans’ air quality, it will also impact the public health and safety of coal workers. We need to move towards cleaner, renewable forms of energy.
author: BernieSanders

text: I stand with the vast majority of the American people in the shared fight for safer gun laws and against the NRA’s corporate influence and ability to buy candidates and elected officials.
author: BernieSanders

text: Make no mistake; we CAN afford to invest in the things that will move this country forward, but only if we get our priorities straight.
author: BernieSanders

text: Any attempt to weaken the will of the American people is an attempt to subvert our democracy. The #WIPowerGrab is undemocratic, unacceptable, and must be addressed.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Trump refuses to accept the reality of climate change, putting short-term profits of polluters before people.

Newsflash, Mr. McNamee: The American people are “buying into” the reality of climate change because it is backed by clear science. Unlike Trump, we stick to the facts.
author: BernieSanders

text: The Trump administration’s policy to separate families is a moral stain on our democracy and Trump must be stopped from making the situation even worse. These families must be reunited immediately, and separations at the border permanently stopped.
author: BernieSanders

text: Climate change is an intersectional issue that will touch each and every one of us and, as such, it must be met with solidarity.
author: BernieSanders

text: The Sears bankruptcy is a prime example of what a rigged economy looks like. Vulture capitalists have hollowed out a company to line their own pockets. It’s time for an economy that works for all of us, not just the wealthy.
author: BernieSanders

text: Transforming our energy system away from fossil fuels doesn’t have to come at the expense of good-paying jobs. We can lead the world in lowering carbon emissions, and in the process of doing so, create millions of new jobs in the sustainable energy.
author: BernieSanders

text: Equal pay is not just a women’s issue; it’s a family issue. When women don’t receive equal pay for equal work, families across America have less money to spend on child care, groceries, and housing.
author: BernieSanders

text: Why is it that we feel comfortable giving tax breaks to corporate billionaires but don’t think we can afford to provide health care for every man, woman, and child in America?
author: BernieSanders

text: If Republicans don’t want to lose power, maybe they should start making policies more representative of people, not corporations and billionaires.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Republicans in Wisconsin and Michigan (who lost statewide races in November) are trying to limit the power of incoming Democratic governors and prevent people from voting in future elections. 

This is incredibly undemocratic.
author: BernieSanders

text: It was not an immigrant picking strawberries at $8 an hour who destroyed the economy in 2008. It was the greed and illegal behavior of Wall Street.
author: BernieSanders

text: President Trump and his friends in the fossil fuel industry are destroying the planet in the name of short-term profits. Enough is enough. We have got to act boldly to combat climate change today.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must create a vibrant democracy where the voices of all people are heard. We must build a nation that leads the world in the struggle for peace and economic, social, racial, and environmental justice.
author: BernieSanders

text: For the last ten years, Congress, giving tax breaks to the rich, has forgotten to raise the minimum wage. $7.25/hr is a starvation wage. After ten years of inaction, it’s time to raise the minimum wage to $15/hour.
author: BernieSanders

text: Raising the minimum wage to $15 an hour may have been a fringe idea a few years ago, but now it is a mainstream idea whose time has come.
author: BernieSanders

text:
We can revitalize our economy:
 increase the minimum wage to $15/hr
 make health care a right
 make public colleges and universities tuition-free
 create millions of jobs in sustainable energy
author: BernieSanders

text: It’s time for a political revolution that takes on fossil fuel billionaires, accelerates our transition to clean energy, and finally puts people before the profits of polluters.
author: BernieSanders

text:
During Trump's campaign, he repeatedly promised the American people that “the rich would not gain at all” from his tax plan. He said it would provide a “big-league tax cut for the middle class."

He lied. 

It’s time for an economy that works for all of us, not just the rich.
author: BernieSanders

text: A small number of major corporations owning and controlling large parts of what we see, hear, read, and buy poses a real threat to the kind democracy we want to be.
author: BernieSanders

text: President George H.W. Bush served our country honorably. He and Barbara will be remembered for their humble and devoted service to the country they loved. Jane and I send our deepest condolences to the entire Bush family.
author: BernieSanders

text:
The debate surrounding climate change has nothing to do with science. 

It has everything to do with money in politics.
author: BernieSanders

text: Congress has got to take on Trump and the fossil fuel industry so we can transform our energy system away from fossil fuels and towards sustainable, efficient energies like solar and wind.
author: BernieSanders

text:
It’s as true today as it was in 1995: 
We have a rigged economy that allows corporations like #Walmart to have an outsized influence on American politics. 

It's time to stand up and demand a country and economy that works for ALL of us, not just a few.
author: BernieSanders

text:
The constitution is clear: 
Congress holds war making powers -- not the president. 

U.S. support for the Saudi-led war in Yemen is unauthorized, unconstitutional, and must end.
author: BernieSanders

text: Unless we take bold and drastic action to address climate change and transform our energy system away from fossil fuels to renewable sources of energy, I fear very much that the world we leave for our kids and grandkids will be in much worse shape than the world we live in today.
author: BernieSanders

text: Not only is climate change real, it is already doing irreparable harm to our planet right here in the United States of America.
author: BernieSanders

text: The question isn’t whether the United States, the wealthiest country in the world, can AFFORD to provide health care for every man, woman, and child. The question is whether we have the moral courage to make a basic human right a priority at the top of our country’s agenda.
author: BernieSanders

text: Our job is to build on our common humanity and do everything that we can to oppose all of the forces, whether unaccountable government power or unaccountable corporate power, who try to divide us up and set us against each other.
author: BernieSanders

text: If our government can provide a trillion dollars in tax breaks to the richest 1% and expand military spending by $165 billion over 2 years, we can surely make public colleges and universities throughout the country tuition-free.
author: BernieSanders

text: The political revolution is about thinking big. It’s not about one election, one candidate, one issue. It’s about creating a movement that will transform the economic, political, social and environmental life of our country.
author: BernieSanders

text: Let's keep the pressure on and make it crystal clear to the world that the United States of America is not going to continue to be part of this horrible Saudi-led coalition in Yemen which is causing so much death and misery.
author: BernieSanders

text: I will go to the floor of the Senate today to try and stop the Saudi-led war in Yemen that has led to the deaths of hundreds of thousands of civilians, mass starvation and one of the greatest humanitarian crises the world now faces.
author: BernieSanders

text: The U.S. should not be part of Saudi Arabia's destructive foreign policy. The Senate must vote this week to end U.S. support for the unauthorized and brutal Saudi-led war in Yemen.
author: BernieSanders

text: We are a nation of immigrants. I am proud to be the son of an immigrant. We must establish an immigration policy that stops the criminalization of communities of color and keeps families together while we push for comprehensive immigration reform.
author: BernieSanders

text: This week I will be bringing SJ Res 54 back for a vote to pull US support from the Saudi-led war in Yemen. The Senate must vote to end US military support for this catastrophe, so we can focus on humanitarian aid and a diplomatic solution.
author: BernieSanders

text: The United States has been Saudi Arabia’s partner in this horrific war in Yemen. We have been providing bombs the Saudi-led coalition is using, refueling their planes, and assisting with intelligence. And in too many cases our weapons are being used to kill civilians.
author: BernieSanders

text: According to the UN, the war in Yemen has created the most severe famine in more than 100 years. In one of the poorest countries on earth, as a result of this war, some 85,000 children have starved to death over the last few years & millions more face death if the war continues.
author: BernieSanders

text: The Trump admin has made it clear they work for the executives and shareholders of predatory for-profit colleges rather than for students and taxpayers. We must reject these predatory policies and move to make public colleges and universities tuition free.
author: BernieSanders

text: This week I will be bringing SJ Res 54 back for a vote to give the Senate another opportunity to end U.S. support for the Saudi-led war in Yemen which has become a humanitarian disaster. We must finally end our support for the carnage in Yemen.
author: BernieSanders

text: The fight @unitehere and the Marriott hotel workers are waging in Hawaii and California and the courage they’re showing is exactly the fight that must be waged in every state in this country. One job should be enough for people to live with dignity.
author: BernieSanders

text: We have got to be bold and aggressive in standing up to the greed of the fossil fuel industry, who are more concerned about short-term profits than the planet we are leaving our kids and our grandchildren.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must end U.S. support for the disastrous Saudi-led war in Yemen. This week the Senate will have the chance to show we are serious about ending U.S. support for this war which has turned into a humanitarian crisis by voting on SJ Res 54.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must end the absurdity of the United States having more people in jail than any other country on Earth. We have a racist criminal justice system that must be fundamentally transformed.
author: BernieSanders

text: There are a record number of immigrant kids being held in federal custody—more than 14,000. We must end this horrific and inhumane practice by the Trump admin and stand in solidarity with immigrant families as we push for comprehensive immigration reform.
author: BernieSanders

text: A job should lift workers out of poverty, not keep them in it. One job should be enough for people to live with security and dignity.
author: BernieSanders

text: Marriott is one of the most profitable hotel companies in the world, yet many of their workers struggle to make ends meet. I stand with @unitehere and the 5,000 hotel workers on the picket line in Hawaii and California fighting for a living wage.
author: BernieSanders

text: In the midst of the worst drug overdose crisis in US history, a pharmaceutical company Kaleo increased the price sixfold for their version of the life-saving drug, Naloxone. The greed of Big Pharma is killing Americans and it has got to stop.
author: BernieSanders

text: This is what a rigged economy is all about. Sears wants to pay its executives as much as $25 million in bonuses after they closed hundreds of stores & let go of thousands of workers. It's time to build an economy that works for all of us, not just the 1%.
author: BernieSanders

text: The American people understand that something is fundamentally unfair when workers earn totally inadequate wages, while the corporations that employ them make billions in profits. Walmart: do the right thing. Raise your minimum wage to $15 an hour.
author: BernieSanders

text: Somebody in America today can walk into a pharmacy and find out that the medicine they have been using for years can double, triple or quadruple overnight. The greed of the prescription drug industry is literally killing Americans and it has got to stop.
author: BernieSanders

text: In the first week of the new Congress, I intend to re-introduce my legislation to raise the federal minimum wage from $7.25 an hour to $15 an hour. This legislation would give more than 40 million low-wage workers a raise, more than 25 percent of the U.S. workforce.
author: BernieSanders

text: All across the country, workers are standing up and demanding fairer wages — and they are winning. Since 2012 when striking fast-food workers launched the @fightfor15 movement, cities and states across the country have passed legislation to raise the minimum wage to $15 an hour.
author: BernieSanders

text: Congress should represent the needs of all the American people, not just the 1%. With a sense of urgency, Democrats must have the courage to take on powerful special interests & fight for a progressive agenda that addresses the needs of working families.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must end the race to the bottom where taxpayers in one city or state are forced to bid against each other for desperately needed jobs. Amazon & other large corporations do not need corporate welfare. Instead, they need to pay their fair share of taxes.
author: BernieSanders

text: It will not be easy, but we will win this struggle for Medicare for All because, increasingly, the American people understand health care is a right and not a privilege - and that we must guarantee health care to every man, woman and child in this country.
author: BernieSanders

text: There is an important truth that we must not forget: If millions of us stand together, educate and organize, there is nothing we cannot accomplish. Together, we can finally create an America that works for all of us, not just the few.
author: BernieSanders

text: Today, the wealthiest 400 individuals in this country own more wealth than the bottom half of America — 150 million Americans.
author: BernieSanders

text: In 1965, the CEO-to-worker compensation ratio was 20-to-1. In 1989, the CEO-to-worker compensation ratio was 58-to-1. Last year, the CEO-to-worker compensation ratio was 312-to-1.
author: BernieSanders

text: Let me be clear: Class warfare goes on in the United States and has for decades. There has been an ongoing massive redistribution of wealth from the working class to the rich. The United States has the most unequal distribution of wealth and income of any major country on earth.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must end the race to the bottom where taxpayers in one city or state are forced to bid against each other for desperately needed jobs. This is what the rigged economy is all about. The rich get richer, and everyone else becomes poorer.
author: BernieSanders

text: If we transition to a renewable energy system, as we must, we can save money and create millions of jobs while leaving our kids a planet that is healthy and habitable.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must end the international embarrassment of the United States being the only major country on earth, the only one, which does not guarantee workers paid medical and family leave, paid sick time and paid vacation time.
author: BernieSanders

text: Congratulations @UNITEHERE26 on this hard fought victory. Hotel workers stood strong for more than six weeks in the wind, the rain, and the snow, up against the largest hotel company in the world and won.
author: BernieSanders

text: The Walton family owns more wealth than the bottom 40% of Americans. Meanwhile, 55% of Walmart’s associates are food insecure. If Walmart can afford $20 billion for stock buybacks, it can afford to raise the pay of its workers to a living wage.
author: BernieSanders

text: Andrew Gillum ran a great progressive campaign. He has transformed politics in Florida and is a key player in the political revolution we are waging.
author: BernieSanders

text: The time is long overdue for Walmart to pay its workers a living wage. If large, profitable corporations like Amazon and Disney can pay all of their workers a minimum wage of at least $15 an hour, so can Walmart.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must stand up and fight any and all attempts to undercut Roe v. Wade. We must protect and expand a woman's right to abortion and reproductive health care services.
author: BernieSanders

text: The struggle for our rights and human dignity is not the struggle of a day or a year – it is the struggle of a lifetime. And it is one that must be hard fought by every generation.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you @staceyabrams for running a brilliant campaign and inspiring people all across this country. Without the outrageous voter suppression that took the place, it’s likely that Stacey would have been elected governor of Georgia. We must never stop fighting to #CountEveryVote
author: BernieSanders

text: If Walmart can manage to find $20 billion for stock buybacks to expand the wealth of Walton family, it can certainly find the money to raise the pay of its workers to a living wage.
author: BernieSanders

text: I'm re-introducing legislation in the first week of the new Congress to raise the federal minimum wage from $7.25 to $15 an hour. Doing so would directly benefit over 41 million workers, including over half of African-American workers and nearly 60% of Latino workers.
author: BernieSanders

text: Medicare for all is an idea that's time has come. It’s now supported by 70% of American voters. In this pivotal moment in American history, we must move forward to guarantee health care as a right.
author: BernieSanders

text: Since Trump's tax cuts were passed, the 1,000 largest public companies have actually reduced employment, on balance. They have announced the elimination of nearly 140,000 jobs — which is almost double the 73,000 jobs they say they have created.
author: BernieSanders

text: We need Medicare for All so that no person in America ever goes bankrupt or loses their life again as a result of the greed of insurance or pharmaceutical companies.
author: BernieSanders

text: The Walton family of Walmart makes more money in a few minutes than most of their workers make in a year. It’s time for Walmart to respect the constitutional rights of their workers to form a union and to give all their workers at least $15 an hour with 7 days of paid sick leave.
author: BernieSanders

text: With over 1.4 million American workers, Walmart is by far our nation’s largest private-sector employer. It’s also one of our nation’s most aggressive anti-union companies with a long history of squelching any and all unionization efforts.
author: BernieSanders

text: The Walton family of Walmart owns more wealth than bottom 40% of the American people, yet Walmart still doesn’t pay their workers a living wage. I’m introducing legislation today to make Walmart finally pay their workers a living wage.
author: BernieSanders

text: Here is the simple truth. Donald Trump, like his friends in Russia, Saudi Arabia and North Korea, is an authoritarian leader who does not believe in democracy. The election officials in FL, GA and AZ must ignore the rantings of this president and COUNT EVERY VOTE.
author: BernieSanders

text: As difficult as it may seem today, we must never lose hope that human beings, and their nations, can resolve international conflicts without bloodshed. We must never cease striving for a world of peace.
author: BernieSanders

text: Today, Veterans Day, we honor the enormous sacrifice and bravery of the men and women who put their lives on the line to defend our country.
author: BernieSanders

text: Never forget that change comes when the people demand it — in the voting booth, in the workplace, and on the streets in peaceful demonstrations. We must remind ourselves of what’s been achieved in the past, and resolve to do equally great things in the future.
author: BernieSanders

text: The current federal minimum wage of $7.25 an hour is a starvation wage and must be raised. The minimum wage must become a living wage. One job should be enough to live with dignity and security.
author: BernieSanders

text: Getting big money out of politics is vital, but much more needs to be done to restore our democracy. Notably, we must ensure that all Americans are guaranteed an effective right to vote. Campaign finance reform must be accompanied by efforts to strengthen voting rights.
author: BernieSanders

text: Our vision for American democracy should be a nation in which all people, regardless of their income, can participate in the political process, and can run for office and be in office without begging for contributions from the wealthy and the powerful.
author: BernieSanders

text: No surprise. Law enforcement says Rick Scott’s allegation of voter fraud was not based in reality. He, and Trump, are just trying to undermine the results if he loses. Count every vote.
author: BernieSanders

text: The election in Georgia is not only about who becomes Governor. It is about protecting the basic tenets of American democracy. @staceyabrams has run a brilliant and inspiring campaign, overcoming enormous obstacles. Now, GA officials must count every vote. https://www.cnn.com/2018/11/09/opinions/dont-let-brian-kemp-steal-georgias-gubernatorial-election-van-jones/index.html …
author: BernieSanders

text: American workers need a pay raise. My $15 an hour minimum wage legislation would increase wages for more than 41 million low-wage workers, almost 30 percent of the U.S. workforce. We need an economy that works for all, not just the few. Let's do it.
author: BernieSanders

text: Young people are the future of our country. They must continue to stand up, fight for their values and help us create a government which works for all, not just the few.
author: BernieSanders

text: The election officials in Florida must not be intimidated by Trump's dishonest, outrageous and anti-democratic outbursts. They must stand up for the democratic process - and count every vote.
author: BernieSanders

text: In 2010, Rick Scott won by 1.2%. In 2014, Rick Scott won by 1%. In both cases he wasn’t worried about voter fraud. Now, with a 0.18% lead, he is deeply concerned about "voter fraud." What hypocrisy! Count every vote in FL, GA and everywhere else. That's what democracy is about.
author: BernieSanders

text: While Republicans across the country are trying to suppress the vote and undermine American democracy, election officials in FL, GA and AZ must do their jobs and count every vote. They must not allow the president, a bully & a pathological liar, or anyone else to intimidate them.
author: BernieSanders

text: The incoming freshman class in Congress is going to be the most progressive freshman class in the modern history of the United States. The political establishment notwithstanding, the future belongs to progressives.
author: BernieSanders

text: We are not going back to the days when women had to risk their lives to end an unwanted pregnancy. The decision about abortion must remain a decision for the woman and her doctor to make, not the government.
author: BernieSanders

text: In this pivotal moment in American history, we must go forward to guarantee health care as a right and not a privilege. Medicare for all is an idea that's time has come.
author: BernieSanders

text: We are not going back to the days when women did not have full access to birth control. When it comes to the rights of women, we cannot go backwards. We have got to go forward.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must stand up and fight for DREAMers and pass a DREAM Act that provides a path towards citizenship for these 800,000 young people.
author: BernieSanders

text: Let me be absolutely clear: Donald Trump, Brian Kemp and Ron DeSantis ran racist campaigns.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you to the people of Vermont for the strong victory they gave me last night. Representing our beautiful state in the U.S. Senate has been the honor of my life and, in my third term, I will continue to do all that I can to stand up for the rights of working people.
author: BernieSanders

text: If you're in line, stay in line!
author: BernieSanders

text: Every vote matters. I won my first election to become Mayor of Burlington by just 10 votes. Your vote can and will have a profound impact on the future of our country and your life. https://iwillvote.com/
author: BernieSanders

text: #ElectionDay should be a national holiday!
author: BernieSanders

text: Jane and I just cast our ballots in Burlington. Together we can end one-party, extreme right-wing rule in Washington and elect progressives across the nation! #VoteWithBernie
author: BernieSanders

text: I voted this morning with my wife @janeosanders in Burlington. Vermont, being your Senator has been the honor of a lifetime and I appreciate your support for a third term.
author: BernieSanders

text: Every vote matters. Please vote today and bring friends, family members and coworkers out to vote. Let's see historic voter turnout nationwide. https://iwillvote.com/
author: BernieSanders

text: Today’s election is the most important midterm election in modern American history. Today, we can put an end to the reactionary Trump agenda and improve the lives of working people -- but that will only happen if you make your voice heard and vote.
author: BernieSanders

text: Four years ago, we had the lowest voter turnout in modern American history. Tomorrow, let's have the highest voter turnout in modern American history.
author: BernieSanders

text: Our job is to do everything we can on Tuesday to re-elect @DaveZuckermanVT for Lieutenant Governor and @TJforVermont for Attorney General of Vermont. Let's make Vermont the progressive leader of the United States of America.
author: BernieSanders

text: Democracy is not a spectator sport. We must all make plans to vote and to bring friends, family members and coworkers out to vote. Let's stand up for justice. Let's stand up for democracy. Let's win on Tuesday. https://iwillvote.com/
author: BernieSanders

text: 71% of American voters believe that Roe v. Wade should not be overturned. We must elect candidates across the nation who will fight for reproductive freedom, justice and equity.
author: BernieSanders

text: There is no doubt in my mind that Republicans will once again attempt to repeal the ACA when they return to Congress as well as try to slash Medicare, Medicaid and Social Security. We can't let them. Let’s get out and vote in record numbers from coast to coast.
author: BernieSanders

text: Let us show Trump at the ballot box that we reject his constant efforts to divide us up by race, religion, national origin and sexual orientation. We must stand together and create an America that works for all of us.
author: BernieSanders

text: The young people of this country have the power to transform their future and the future of their children and grandchildren. This is your moment—but only if you take advantage of it. Find your polling place here:

author: BernieSanders

text: Trump is getting very, very nervous because he knows with your help on November 6th, @AndrewGillum is going to be elected the next governor of Florida.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you to the students of the University of New Hampshire for having me this afternoon. It is my belief that the young people of this country are the most progressive generation in American history. If you vote in historic numbers on Tuesday, you will transform this nation.
author: BernieSanders

text: It was great to be in Montpelier this morning with many incredible candidates running up and down the ballot in Vermont and to see so many people energized and ready to fight for justice for all. Let’s win on November 6th!
author: BernieSanders

text: I moved to Stannard when I first came to Vermont. I’ve visited 13 states in the last 3 weeks but coming home to Stannard was very special to me.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you, Grand Isle and Enosburg. Our job is not to divide; our job is to bring people together.
author: BernieSanders

text: Our job is to do everything we can to get people involved in the political process. Instead of having the lowest voter turnout in modern history, let us do everything that we can to have the highest voter turnout.
author: BernieSanders

text: This is a pivotal moment in American history. Let us rise to the historic occasion and do everything we can these next 4 days to end one-party rule in Washington and elect progressives from coast to coast.
author: BernieSanders

text: I urge you all to never underestimate the value of your voice, the power of your vote, and the potential that comes from people organizing around issues they care deeply about. What seems impossible can be made possible when millions of people stand united.
author: BernieSanders

text: If people under 30 voted at the same percentage as the rest of the general population, they would transform America. You have extraordinary power to shape the history of this country.
author: BernieSanders

author: BernieSanders

text: I'll be on @reddit_AMA at 2 p.m. EST to talk about the upcoming election. Ask me anything!

text: We are one people who share a common humanity. And we say to Trump today, we are not going backwards into more discrimination, we are going forward to celebrate our diversity.

It is not an exaggeration to say that lives are at stake in this election.

text: In campaigns and in life in general you're going to have to do things that make you uncomfortable. But that's okay because this is how we grow.

New York City has the opportunity on Election Day to help us end billionaire domination of American politics. 

If Question #1 passes, it will be an example to the country of strong and sensible campaign finance reform. Let's do it!

author: BernieSanders

text: In striving to be a moral and just society, it is critical that we have the courage to stand with the poor, the vulnerable and with working people, and be willing to stand up to the very powerful and those who seek to divide us up by race, gender, sexuality and nationality.

Iowa: this is your chance to have real leadership. Elect @Scholten4Iowa next week!

7 days.

When we stand together and demand that this country works for all of us rather than just the few, we can transform America. Let’s do everything we can these next 7 days to make that happen.

text:
Today, I would like to endorse some of the ballot measures in states across the country. 

California: Proposition 10
Florida: Amendment 4
Colorado: YES on Amendment 73 and Proposition 112 and NO on Amendment 74
Massachusetts: Question 1
Washington: Initiative 1631

Thread
author: BernieSanders

text: "We have to end the legacy of oppression in this country and one way we can do that is with our vote." – @kendrick38
author: BernieSanders

text: I want to thank the many activists I met with who informed me about these important ballot measures nationwide which can help us create a fairer and just society. We must rise to the historic occasion and make sure we have record voter turnout so we can transform this nation.
author: BernieSanders

text: With the recent report from the IPCC noting the drastic action required to prevent the worst impacts of climate change, Initiative 1631 is an important step forward for the people of Washington State.
author: BernieSanders

text: Question 1 in Massachusetts would set a safe maximum on the number of patients nurses can treat, so that patients can receive the quality care they deserve. Nurses are behind this initiative, and I trust them when it comes to knowing what is best for their patients.
author: BernieSanders

text: Florida has the opportunity to re-enfranchise 1.4 million formerly incarcerated people to fully participate as citizens. Passing Amendment 4 is an important step for both voting rights and criminal justice reform.
author: BernieSanders

text: Given the crisis we face with climate change, in my view we should move toward a total ban on fracking. At a minimum, it seems obvious that we must protect communities from the environmental damage that fracking causes. In my view Colorado voters should support 112.
author: BernieSanders

text: Colorado Amendment 74, pushed by the fossil fuel industry, seems to be one of the most dangerous propositions in the country. It could open the flood gates for oil, gas and other corporate interests to bankrupt the state. This extremely dangerous amendment must be defeated.
author: BernieSanders

text: How is it possible that in Colorado a majority of school districts can only afford to keep their schools open 4 days a week? How are teachers paid wages so low that some have to work two jobs to survive? Our kids deserve a high-quality education. Amendment 73 is a no-brainer.
author: BernieSanders

text: Currently California cities and towns aren't permitted to pass rent control measures to address the affordable housing crisis. That should change. Municipalities should have the freedom to deal with the decline in affordable housing and rising rents. Let's pass Prop 10.
author: BernieSanders

text:
I’m excited to announce I’ll be doing three rallies in Vermont next Saturday Nov 3rd with great progressives from up and down the ballot in Grand Isle, Enosburg and Stannard.

Enosburg: https://act.berniesanders.com/event/rallies_attend/54 …

author: BernieSanders

text: We have got to end the bigotry and hatred that is sweeping this country.
author: BernieSanders

text: In too many of these cases the pattern is the same. The gun delivers the fatal shots and hate pulls the trigger. We have got to do everything we can to end these horrific acts of violence and address the growing epidemic of hatred, as well as gun safety in this country.

text: I am deeply saddened by the news of a shooting at a synagogue in Pittsburgh. Several years ago a hateful person walked into a church in Charleston. Today there was another act of violence – this time at a synagogue.

Paul Ryan is everything that is wrong with the Republican party. He wants to cut Social Security and Medicare to pay for massive tax cuts for billionaires.

That is exactly why we must defeat Ryan's hand-picked successor and elect @IronStache to Congress.
author: BernieSanders

text: Four years ago, in 2014, we had the lowest voter turnout since World War II. In 2018, we have to turn that upside-down. If we continue to fight for each other — for economic, social, racial and environmental justice — we will win in November and beyond.
author: BernieSanders

text: It was an honor to be on the picket line today with @UNITEHERE30 in San Diego. The fight you are waging and the courage you are showing here is exactly the fight that must be waged in every state in this country. One job should be enough for people to live with dignity.

text: What we are saying to Westin, Marriott and every corporation that makes billions of dollars in profits is: Pay your workers a living wage! #MarriottStrike

text: One thing I learned at my first union job at a young age is that one worker alone can beg for a wage, can beg for decent working conditions, can beg for some retirement benefits, but when people stand together they don’t have to beg. They can win what they rightfully deserve.
author: BernieSanders

text: Standing with workers on picket lines is something I've done my entire life-- that's what I do and what I believe. Unions are my family.
author: BernieSanders

text: Marriott made $3.4 billion in profits last year and its CEO made over $13 million. Meanwhile, Marriott workers are struggling to make ends meet. I stand with Marriott workers fighting for safe working conditions and a living wage.

text: If young people vote in this election, they will transform America.
author: BernieSanders

text:
Billionaires made more money in 2017 than any other year in history.

To the billionaire class I say: you can't have it all. You can't get huge tax breaks while children in this country go hungry. Your greed must end.

text: We create change when we demand change. Women’s rights, civil rights, LGBTQ rights, and workers’ rights were all advanced through collective struggle. We must remind ourselves of what’s been achieved in the past, and resolve to do equally great things in the future.

text: Nearly 70% of young Americans agree we need to make public colleges and university tuition free. If other countries can take this action, so can the United States of America.
