text: The Trump administration’s announcement that it would again dramatically cut the number of refugees allowed into the United States to an historic low is a shameful abdication of our nation’s role as a protector of vulnerable people fleeing persecution.
author: BernieSanders

text: Medicaid work requirements are nothing more than an attack on the poor. We must defeat these attacks on the poor and the downtrodden and reject this kind of destructive austerity.
author: BernieSanders

text: I am proud to be supporting @jessforcongress in Pennsylvania’s 11th Congressional District. The grassroots energy Jess has inspired in Lancaster and York counties is a testament to her leadership and her progressive vision.
author: BernieSanders

text: A job must lift workers out of poverty, not keep them in it. The current federal minimum wage of $7.25 an hour is a starvation wage and must be raised to a living wage.
author: BernieSanders

text: Stable and affordable housing is not only essential to live with dignity, but without it, economic opportunity is an illusion. It makes it very difficult for families to keep up, and near impossible to get ahead or save for retirement or higher education.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must expand Social Security so everyone in Vermont and throughout this country can retire with the dignity they have earned and all those struggling with a disability can live with the security they need.
author: BernieSanders

text:
I’m excited to announce I’ll be doing three events in Vermont this Saturday with progressive candidates from up and down the ballot.

Stowe at 9:30AM: https://www.facebook.com/events/236438610386784/ …
Troy at 1PM: https://www.facebook.com/events/261136707940391/ …
St. Johnsbury at 5PM: https://www.facebook.com/events/1920606711569553/ …
author: BernieSanders

text: Medicare for all is an idea that's time has come. This is a struggle not just about health care but about the heart and soul of our country, about what we stand for as a people. And it is a struggle we are winning.
author: BernieSanders

text: In an attempt to offset the tax breaks Trump and the Republicans gave to billionaires and to large, profitable corporations, they're going to try to cut programs for the elderly, the children, working families of this country, and the poor.
author: BernieSanders

text: 60% of the American people now agree we need to make public colleges and university tuition free. If other countries can take this action, so can the United States of America.
author: BernieSanders

text: It’s no surprise the Trump administration lied to the American people yet again. The amount of money that has come back to the U.S. after President Trump’s tax cuts for billionaires and large, profitable corporations is just 3.5% of what Trump predicted.
author: BernieSanders

text: We live in a nation that spent centuries denying the right to vote to the poor, to women, and to people of color. We must restore the Voting Rights Act and protect voters from attempts to disenfranchise them before the elections take place.
author: BernieSanders

text: There are five times as many kids in child detention centers now than there were a year ago. Trump’s cruelty towards migrant children are heartless and unconscionable. We must stop the criminalization of immigrant communities and keep families together.
author: BernieSanders

text: Solidarity with the thousands of hotel workers in Chicago who are striking at 26 hotels across the city, demanding raises, safer workloads, increased sick days, improved job security and year-round health insurance. http://inthesetimes.com/working/entry/21433/thousands_of_chicago_workers_are_out_on_the_first_citywide_hotel_strike_in …
author: BernieSanders

text: 72% of Americans support increasing, not cutting Social Security benefits by asking millionaires and billionaires to pay more into the system. Our job now is to rally the American people to get our priorities right.
author: BernieSanders

text: Social Security is one of the most popular and successful government programs in the history of our country. We must expand it so that everyone in America can retire with the respect that they have earned and deserve after a lifetime of hard work.
author: BernieSanders

text: Today is Constitution Day which recognizes its adoption and those who have become U.S. citizens. In this pivotal moment in American history, we must each affirm our commitment to civic engagement. If you aren't registered to vote, please do so today. https://www.rockthevote.org/register-to-vote/ …
author: BernieSanders

text: It was so nice to see so many new Americans from many different backgrounds today in Burlington. I want to extend a very warm welcome to you all in Vermont and the United States of America. Thank you to @diengali and community leaders who brought us together.
author: BernieSanders

text: It was great to be with @AFTunion Vermont this morning in Burlington. Teachers, nurses, and the trade union movement have been and always will be the backbone of this country.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you to my dear friend @gracepotter for having me at @GrandPointNorth Festival in Burlington, Vermont. It was great to see Grace, @kennychesney and thousands energized to fight for social justice.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must build on our common humanity and do everything that we can to oppose all of the forces, whether unaccountable government power or unaccountable corporate power, who try to divide us up and set us against each other.
author: BernieSanders

text: Public education is fundamental to any functioning democratic society, and teaching is one of its most valuable and indispensable professions. We need to pay teachers enough to live comfortably without taking on other work, period.
author: BernieSanders

text: It’s not only low wages that are of great concern with regard to Amazon. There are deeply disturbing stories about working conditions at fulfillment centers run by Amazon and its contractors.
author: BernieSanders

text: Arkansas’s Medicaid work requirement numbers reveal that for every one new person working, volunteering, or training, almost 50 people lost their health insurance. These policies do nothing but punish the poor for being poor and can have deadly impacts.
author: BernieSanders

text: One year ago, the Medicare for All Act was introduced to guarantee health care to everyone. Today, Medicare for All is more popular than ever with 70% of American voters supporting it. Let’s go forward together and make health care a right, not a privilege.
author: BernieSanders

text: Social Security is the most successful government program in our nation’s history. Our job must be to expand it so that every American can retire with dignity and respect they deserve.
author: BernieSanders

text: In these final few weeks before a potential vote, it is incumbent upon all of us to mobilize ourselves and our nation to defeat Brett Kavanaugh’s nomination. https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/made-by-history/wp/2018/07/10/with-the-appointment-of-brett-kavanaugh-roe-v-wade-is-likely-dead/ …
author: BernieSanders

text: Just ahead of hurricane season, the Trump administration redirected $10 million from FEMA to ICE so they’d have more money for detention centers and to separate and detain immigrant families. We have got to get our priorities right as a country.
author: BernieSanders

text: GoFundMe is not health care. Yet that is how thousands and thousands of people across the country are trying to stay alive. We must make health care a right to all regardless of ability to pay. We must have Medicare for all.
author: BernieSanders

text: I am proud that my home state of Vermont is taking steps to hold these companies accountable. It is time for Congress to follow Vermont’s lead and investigate these companies’ role in the opioid crisis.
author: BernieSanders

text: I’m proud to be supporting @ZephyrTeachout for New York State Attorney General. Zephyr understands better than anybody how special interests try to buy off politicians, and she's dedicated her life to fixing our broken political system.
author: BernieSanders

text: The greed of the prescription drug industry is literally killing Americans. No, Mr. Mulye, it is not "moral" to quadruple the price of a life-saving antibiotic. It is the exact opposite of what should happen in a moral society.
author: BernieSanders

text: As Franklin Delano Roosevelt reminded us, a nation’s greatness is judged not by what it provides to the most well-off, but how it treats the people most in need. And that’s the kind of nation we must become.
author: BernieSanders

text: Real change never occurs from the top on down, always from the bottom on up. That is the history of America, whether it is the creation of the trade union movement, the civil rights movement, the women’s movement, the LGBTQ rights movement.
author: BernieSanders

text: We are the only major country on earth that does not guarantee health care to all people as a right. It’s time we change that.
author: BernieSanders

text: I’m proud to be supporting @JumaaneWilliams for Lieutenant Governor of New York. Jumaane has dedicated his life to fighting for justice, equality and dignity for all and is a champion for the working class.
author: BernieSanders

text: President Trump is trying to make it easier for oil and gas companies to leak methane. This is totally absurd. We should be aggressively transitioning our economy away from fossil fuels toward sustainable energy.
author: BernieSanders

text: We need to expand, not eliminate, the collective bargaining rights of all Americans. I stand with the workers at Tesla who are trying to organize a union.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must act boldly to move our energy system away from fossil fuels, and towards energy efficiency and sustainable energy sources. We have a moral responsibility to leave our kids a planet that is healthy and habitable.
author: BernieSanders

text: This is what oligarchy is all about. This is why we have to overturn Citizens United and move to public funding of elections.
author: BernieSanders

text: I am confident @ZephyrTeachout will combat corruption wherever it hides as Attorney General. Zephyr's work to reform our campaign finance system demonstrates her commitment to ensuring that the government works for all people and not just the wealthy and the powerful.
author: BernieSanders

text: In Albany I know @JumaaneWilliams will work hard for everyone as Lieutenant Governor because he has shown himself to be a bold and independent leader who never stops fighting for economic, social, racial and environmental justice.
author: BernieSanders

text: We need to elect all the progressives running in New York. I would like to offer endorsements to two candidates I have known for many years, and are leaders of the progressive movement in New York: @JumaaneWilliams for Lieutenant Governor and @ZephyrTeachout for Attorney General.
author: BernieSanders

text: Real freedom must include economic security. That was FDR’s vision over 70 years ago. It is my vision today. It is a vision that we have not yet achieved. It is time that we did.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must fight to make certain that women throughout the country have the right to control their own bodies. We need to stand up for Roe v. Wade now more than ever and stand together to defeat Brett Kavanaugh’s Supreme Court nomination.
author: BernieSanders

text: Richard Sackler helped cause the opioid crisis through aggressive marketing and lobbying of the opioid painkiller OxyContin. Now he’s trying to profit from addiction treatment. Sackler cannot continue to profit off of people's suffering.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must end the revolving door from the oil and gas industry to the very agencies that are supposed to be regulating them and are tasked with protecting the environment.
author: BernieSanders

text: Republicans don't push the myth of voter fraud because it is an actual problem. They push it to maintain the racist voting laws that have kept them in power for generations.
author: BernieSanders

text: If we could bail out Wall Street in 2008, we can certainly make public colleges and universities tuition free throughout the country.
author: BernieSanders

text: And a very Happy Birthday to you!
author: BernieSanders

text: It is my belief that the younger generation is in many ways the most progressive generation in the history of our country. Please continue to convert your idealism and generosity of spirit into political activity.
author: BernieSanders

text: If Supreme Court nominee Brett Kavanaugh is confirmed, Roe v. Wade could be overturned in less than a year. Nothing is more important now than doing everything in our power to stop this nomination.
author: BernieSanders

text: Aaron has worked hard to raise wages, combat climate change, and make voting more accessible. He championed guaranteed sick leave and supports a Medicare-for-all health care system. I hope you will join me in supporting @AaronRegunberg for Lieutenant Governor of Rhode Island.
author: BernieSanders

text: I am proud to endorse @AaronRegunberg for Lieutenant Governor of Rhode Island. Aaron has shown himself to be a real fighter for Rhode Islanders during his time in the legislature and, in my view, would make an excellent Lieutenant Governor.
author: BernieSanders

text: Climate change is a clear and present danger to all Americans and ignoring it is not an option. We must take on the fossil fuel billionaires, accelerate our transition to clean energy, and finally put people before the profits of polluters.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must end sub-minimum wages and implement one fair wage, so that all minimum wage workers earn the same amount.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you, President Obama.
author: BernieSanders

text: Congratulations to Disney workers and their unions. This is an important step forward in making sure that all American workers earn a living wage.
author: BernieSanders

text: Change comes when the people demand it — in the voting booth, in the workplace, and on the streets in peaceful demonstrations. We must remind ourselves of what’s been achieved in the past, and resolve to do equally great things in the future.
author: BernieSanders

text: We need to remember the price that was paid for the right to vote. The Voting Rights Act was one of the great victories of the civil rights movement. The time to stand up and fight Brett Kavanaugh’s nomination is now.
author: BernieSanders

text: We cannot allow ourselves to be divided by this anti-immigrant and xenophobic hysteria. This plan must be defeated and the criminalization of immigrants and people of color in this country must end.
author: BernieSanders

text: If Brett Kavanaugh is confirmed to the Supreme Court, it could be the most extreme court on civil rights issues since the days of Jim Crow. We must stand together and defeat Kavanaugh’s nomination.
author: BernieSanders

text: More than 4,500 low-income Arkansans lost their health insurance over the weekend as the first-in-the-nation Medicaid work requirements took effect. This type of austerity does nothing but punish the poor and often has deadly impacts.
author: BernieSanders

text: Brett Kavanaugh doesn't believe that Roe v. Wade is settled law and he would be the final vote to overturn it. It is urgent that we stand up for the rights of women and abortion access. We must do everything we can to defeat Brett Kavanaugh’s Supreme Court nomination.
author: BernieSanders

text: Donald Trump stated repeatedly during the campaign that any Supreme Court nominee of his would vote to overturn Roe v. Wade. I have no doubt that is exactly what Brett Kavanaugh will do if confirmed.
author: BernieSanders

text: It is vital that those of us who care about the environment and human health, about fighting climate change, and about leaving a planet that is livable for our children and grandchildren come together to do everything we can to defeat Brett Kavanaugh’s Supreme Court nomination.
author: BernieSanders

text: President Trump’s "dumb Southerner" comment is elitist, despicable, divisive and contemptuous. We cannot allow this administration to divide us up. We must stand together and build an America that works for all of us, not just the few.
author: BernieSanders

text: The Walton family of Walmart owns more wealth than the bottom 40% of Americans. Walmart, just like Amazon, pays its workers’ wages that are so inadequate that many of them are forced to depend upon public assistance programs in order to survive.
author: BernieSanders

text: It is not only Mr. Bezos who should be concerned that the days of corporations receiving huge subsidies while paying workers poverty wages are coming to an end. The Walton family of Walmart should be concerned too.
author: BernieSanders

text: The most devastating fact about the impacts of climate change is that people who live in low-income and minority communities bear the most severe consequences.
author: BernieSanders

text: Yesterday Amazon hit a market cap of $1 trillion and Jeff Bezos became $2 billion richer, while 1 in 3 Amazon workers in Arizona are on food stamps because their wages are so low. Today I introduced legislation to get Amazon off corporate welfare and to pay workers a living wage.
author: BernieSanders

text: Brett Kavanaugh’s Supreme Court nomination is a dire threat to Roe v. Wade and the right of women to control their own bodies, voting rights, campaign finance reform, workers’ rights, health care, climate change, environmental protection and gun safety.
author: BernieSanders

text: Congratulations to @AyannaPressley for her upset win in Massachusetts 7th Congressional District. Change can't wait. The political revolution continues.
author: BernieSanders

text: Tomorrow I am introducing legislation to end the absurdity of working class Americans having to subsidize large, profitable corporations, many of which are owned by billionaires like Jeff Bezos.
author: BernieSanders

text: There is little doubt that, if appointed, Brett Kavanaugh would support the agenda of billionaires, corporations, and right-wing extremists. I will vote against the nomination of Brett Kavanaugh to become the next Supreme Court Justice and urge my fellow Senators to do the same.
author: BernieSanders

text: The pharmaceutical industry's greed is costing Americans' lives. Enough is enough. Their greed must end.
author: BernieSanders

text: It’s not only low wages that are of concern with regard to Amazon. There are deeply disturbing stories about working conditions at fulfillment centers run by Amazon and its contractors.
author: BernieSanders

text: I would like to acknowledge Claire Wineland who passed away last night. You are an inspiration and brought joy to many. You’ll be missed deeply.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you, Middlebury. When we come together, there is nothing we cannot accomplish.
author: BernieSanders

text: On Labor Day, it's worth stating that 54% of American workers say they're threatened with loss of their job if they vote to unionize. We must empower workers and make it easier to unionize.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you, White River Junction. Today, on Labor Day, we must recommit ourselves to bringing all working people together in the fight for a more just and humane world.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you to the more than 400 members of New Hampshire’s labor community who joined me this morning for the AFL-CIO Labor Day breakfast in Manchester. Today we celebrate the principle of solidarity.
author: BernieSanders

text: These workers fought to build the trade union movement. They fought against child labor, low wages and dangerous working conditions. They fought for decent health care, pensions and education. They fought to end racism and sexism in the workforce.
author: BernieSanders

text: Let us never forget that Labor Day is not just about picnics, barbecues and parades. It is about remembering the struggles of incredibly brave men and women who stood up and fought back against corporate greed, and sometimes lost their lives in the process.
author: BernieSanders

text: I’m proud to be supporting @AndrewGillum, @staceyabrams, and @BenJealous. We live in an unprecedented moment in American history, and we need an unprecedented response. Let’s stand with them and reshape history this November.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must end U.S. support for this disastrous war in Yemen. It is also long past time that we begin to take a very hard look at our relationship with Saudi Arabia.
author: BernieSanders

text: There is simply no question as to whose side the Trump administration is really on. Not the working class. Just the ruling class.
author: BernieSanders

text: 41% of college students are skipping meals to be able to afford textbooks which have skyrocketed in cost in recent years. This absurdity must end and it’s time to make public colleges and universities tuition-free across the country.
author: BernieSanders

text: This is why we fight for a fair economy. This is why we fight for billionaires and corporations to pay their fair share in taxes. This is why unions are necessary. This is why we demand living wages.
author: BernieSanders

text: All over this country, many Amazon employees, who work for the wealthiest person on Earth, are paid wages so low they can’t make ends meet. The American taxpayer should not be subsidizing Jeff Bezos so he can underpay his employees.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must stand with every educator in this country until they’re given the wages and benefits they deserve, and every public school is sufficiently funded so that our students can succeed. http://inthesetimes.com/working/entry/21398/teachers_strike_school_year_west_virginia_oklahoma_washington …
author: BernieSanders

text: The Saudi-led intervention in Yemen, with U.S. support, has been a humanitarian disaster. Instead of supplying bombs, refueling capabilities, and now training to Saudi pilots, we should be doing everything possible to create a peaceful resolution and provide humanitarian help.
author: BernieSanders

text: The Pentagon is planning to train Saudi Arabian pilots on US soil for what appears to be the first time since a Saudi-led coalition intervened in Yemen’s civil war. The training will be for warplanes including the F-15, which the Saudis are using in Yemen.
author: BernieSanders

text: Trump’s massive tax cuts for the wealthy and corporations are fueling a vicious cycle of money in politics. Some of the biggest beneficiaries of his tax cuts are now making huge donations to help Republicans keep control of Congress.
author: BernieSanders

text: I’m proud to be supporting @staceyabrams for Governor of Georgia, @BenJealous for Governor of Maryland, and @AndrewGillum for Governor of Florida. Victories for these three great candidates will change America in a very significant way.
author: BernieSanders

text: The Trump administration's anti-immigrant and white supremacist agenda is now unjustly denying passports to thousands of U.S. citizens simply because of the color of their skin. We will not be divided and these racist policies will be defeated.
author: BernieSanders

text: Here’s the bottom line: the taxpayers of this country should not have to subsidize employees at a company owned by Mr. Bezos who is worth $155 billion. That's absurd and it’s going to end. On September 5th I am introducing legislation to do exactly that.
author: BernieSanders

text: It is a moral outrage that in the richest nation on Earth we can’t even provide clean drinking water to our children in schools. It is time to get our priorities right as a country.
author: BernieSanders

text: I’d like to thank @NomikiKonst, @jjz1600, @ninaturner, Jeff Weaver, Gus Newport, Larry Cohen, @LucyFlores and @janekleeb for all of their hard work on the Unity Reform Commission. You all worked tirelessly on successful reforms and for that I am truly grateful.
author: BernieSanders

text:
I’m excited to announce I’ll be doing two rallies in Vermont this upcoming Monday for Labor Day in White River Junction and Middlebury.

White River Junction at 1PM: https://www.facebook.com/events/289782584954742/ …
Middlebury Town Green at 4PM: https://www.facebook.com/events/2177689569140146/ …
author: BernieSanders

text: As @AndrewGillum has said, money doesn’t vote. People do. If you live in Florida and aren’t registered to vote, please do so today so we can make Andrew Gillum the next Governor of Florida. The impossible is possible. Let’s #BringItHome this November. https://registertovoteflorida.gov
author: BernieSanders

text: This type of disenfranchisement is just another method of voter suppression and criminalization of people of color which must be ended. The fight for voting rights is a fight for justice. It is inseparable from the struggle for democracy itself.
author: BernieSanders

text: Crystal Mason faces five years in jail—for the crime of voting. We are facing a crisis of voter suppression in this country and a big part of that is felon disenfranchisement, which has cost six million Americans their right to vote.
author: BernieSanders

text: Unbelievably, in America today there are 44 million Americans who owe more than $1.5 trillion in student debt. It’s time to make colleges, universities and trade schools tuition free in America.
author: BernieSanders

text: I'd also like to congratulate Dotie Joseph and Cindy Polo for their primary wins for FL State House and Wesley Anne Beggs for Sarasota County Commissioner. Their wins show we can win seemingly impossible campaigns if we run on issues that speak to the needs of working people.
author: BernieSanders

text: Congratulations to @AndrewGillum on his victory. Tonight, Floridians joined Andrew in standing up and demanding real change and showed our nation what is possible when we stand together. Let's make history this November and make Andrew Gillum the next Governor of Florida.
author: BernieSanders

text: Medicare for all is an idea that's time has come. If every major country on earth can guarantee health care as a right, please do not tell me the United States cannot.
author: BernieSanders

text: I applaud everyone who stood up to demand that workers at one of the wealthiest corporations in the world should have a decent standard of living.
author: BernieSanders

text: For Florida State House, I am proud to support @CarlosGSmith in District 49, @AnnaForFlorida in District 47, @ElectMangold in District 28, @DotieForFlorida in District 108, @votemcfadden in District 106, and @CindyPoloFL103 in District 103. Let’s make history today, Florida!
author: BernieSanders

text: Let’s also elect many terrific down-ballot candidates who will play a pivotal role in reshaping Florida towards a more progressive future. I am proud to be supporting @votesanjaypatel in Florida’s 8th Congressional District and @WinWithWesley for Sarasota County Commission.
author: BernieSanders

text: Today is our chance to make history. Let’s get out the vote today to transform Florida and this nation by electing @AndrewGillum to be the next Governor of Florida.
author: BernieSanders

text: It is deeply troubling that the federal official in charge of protecting student borrowers from predatory lending practices stepped down today, saying himself this administration has turned its back on young people and their financial futures.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must confront the oppressive burden of student debt that afflicts and harms far too many young people in our country. It’s time to make public colleges, universities, and vocational schools tuition free in the United States.
author: BernieSanders

text: All across the nation, there are progressive ballot initiatives at the state level that can help us create a fairer and just society. The opportunity to expand Medicaid to hundreds of thousands of people is on the ballot in Nebraska, Idaho and Utah.
author: BernieSanders

text: New data shows one in three Amazon employees in Arizona are on food stamps. It is completely unacceptable that ordinary Americans should be subsidizing the wealthiest people in the world like Jeff Bezos when they pay their employees such inadequate wages.
author: BernieSanders

text: This is a victory in the struggle for millions of workers all across this country who are sick and tired of working longer hours for lower wages. When workers organize and stand together, they win.
author: BernieSanders

text: Today's decision by the DNC is an important step forward in making the Democratic Party more open, democratic and responsive to the input of ordinary Americans. This has been a long and arduous process, and I want to thank @TomPerez and all of those who made it happen.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must remember that the struggle for our rights is not a struggle for one day, or one year, or one generation – it is the struggle of a lifetime, and one that must be fought by every generation.
author: BernieSanders

text: Make absolutely no mistake about it, our ideas are winning. Overwhelming majorities of people have come around to some of our major policy proposals like Medicare for all and tuition-free college in incredibly short amounts of time. Let’s keep pushing.
author: BernieSanders

text: Disney prides itself on making dreams come true. Their workers deserve to be paid a living wage.
author: BernieSanders

text: The United States must end the international embarrassment of being the only major country on earth, the only one, which does not guarantee workers paid medical and family leave, paid sick time and paid vacation time.
author: BernieSanders

text: The working families of this country should not have to subsidize the wealthiest people in the United States of America like Jeff Bezos. It’s absurd and it’s what a rigged economy is all about.
author: BernieSanders

text: It is imperative that we have the courage to stand with the poor, the marginalized, the vulnerable, and are willing to stand up to the very powerful and wealthy in our society.
author: BernieSanders

text: As @SummerForPA and @Innamo have demonstrated in Pittsburgh, we can win seemingly impossible campaigns if we run on issues that speak to the needs of working people while harnessing the grassroots energy to drive our campaigns forward.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must transform our energy system to renewable energy and stop letting oil executives call the shots. We can't let the fossil fuel industry continue to get away with devastating our planet and making a profit off it. https://www.cbs42.com/news/us-and-world/big-oil-asks-government-to-protect-it-from-climate-change/1388352229 …
author: BernieSanders

text: As Martin Luther King Jr. said in 1968: This country has socialism for the rich and rugged individualism for the poor.
author: BernieSanders

text: 70% of American voters now support a Medicare for all, single-payer system and 60% now support tuition-free college. Our ideas are winning and these are struggles we will win together.
author: BernieSanders

text: I hope when the day comes that our children and grandchildren look us in the eye and ask, “What did you do about climate change?” We can proudly say we did everything we could; we successfully transformed our political system and left them a planet that is healthy and habitable.
author: BernieSanders

text: There are 140 million poor & low income people in this country. This does not have to be. It is an immoral failure of will in the richest nation in the world that we let so many people live in poverty.
author: BernieSanders

text: The Trump administration's hostility to refugees, and immigrants in general is deeply disturbing and shameful. We have a responsibility to the world's refugees to offer welcome and compassion.
author: BernieSanders

text: I appreciate the honesty from my Republican colleague who said what we’ve known all along. They’ve always been dead set on wanting to slash Medicare and Social Security and will use deficits created by their own tax cuts for billionaires to try to do so.
author: BernieSanders

text: I’m proud to endorse @Deb4CongressNM to represent New Mexico’s 1st Congressional District. Her experience is what will make her a fierce champion for workers, for students, for women, for Native Americans, and for everyone who has been sidelined by the billionaire class.
author: BernieSanders

text: As Americans, we must ask ourselves one fundamental question, and that is whether or not this is the kind of country and economic culture we are comfortable with. I am not. And I don’t believe you are either.
author: BernieSanders

text: Think about how hard that family member has to work for an entire year, the days she or he goes into work sick, or has a sick child, or struggles to buy school supplies or Christmas presents, to make what one man makes in 10 seconds.
author: BernieSanders

text: Count to ten. In those ten seconds, Jeff Bezos, the owner and founder of Amazon, just made more money than the median employee of Amazon makes in an entire year. An entire year.
author: BernieSanders

text: Climate change is the single greatest threat facing our planet and the Trump administration is shamefully putting the interests of a few coal barons before those of our planet and our children and grandchildren.
author: BernieSanders

text: I’m glad to hear 22 state attorneys general and the District of Columbia have filed a brief to overturn the FCC's disastrous decision to repeal net neutrality. This fight is not over.
author: BernieSanders

text: The state of Arizona is violating the National Voter Registration Act, putting more than 500,000 voters at risk of being disenfranchised. This type of voter suppression must be stopped.
author: BernieSanders

text: I am so inspired by the young people mobilizing and organizing to put people before polluters, combat climate change, and lead a transition to clean energy. You have the power to change America and this world.
author: BernieSanders

text: Week after week, we see the cruelty of this administration's policies with their unrelenting attacks on the elderly, the children, the disabled, and the poor of this country who need our social safety net the most.
author: BernieSanders

text: Trump’s power plant proposal is reckless and threatens a habitable planet for future generations. We need to take on the fossil fuel billionaires, accelerate our transition to clean energy, and finally put people before the profits of polluters.
author: BernieSanders

text: It is long past time to end U.S. support through the sales of bombs, targeting intelligence and refueling for planes for this misbegotten, unconstitutional and unwinnable war in Yemen.
author: BernieSanders

text: This is voter suppression. These cowardly efforts to make it harder and harder for African Americans to vote must be stopped and we must do everything we can to make it easier for all Americans to vote.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must end the international disgrace of the United States being the only major country on Earth not to guarantee health care to all of our people. We must move to a Medicare for all, single-payer system.
author: BernieSanders

text: For the past 40 years, Wall Street and the billionaire class have rigged the rules to redistribute wealth and income to the wealthiest and most powerful people of this country. We must stand up, organize, and fight back.
author: BernieSanders

text: The US must stop supporting this catastrophic war. We cannot say we did not know. Instead of supplying bombs and refueling capabilities, we should be doing everything possible to create a peaceful resolution in Yemen and provide humanitarian help. https://edition.cnn.com/2018/08/17/middleeast/us-saudi-yemen-bus-strike-intl/index.html …
author: BernieSanders

text: I'm proud to be supporting 9 incredible candidates running for office in Florida. Early voting has begun so let's get out the vote to transform Florida from the bottom on up!
author: BernieSanders

text: We must stop spending endlessly on war, mass incarceration and tax breaks for billionaires while ignoring the basic needs of our children, the elderly and those who need the most help in our country.
author: BernieSanders

text: It is shameful that we invest so little in education in this country that some schools cannot be in session for a full week. Our priorities must change.
author: BernieSanders

text: How does it make sense for CEOs to be making hundreds or even thousands of times more than their employees, at a time when millions of American workers are barely getting by?
author: BernieSanders

text: I’ve said it from the beginning, and I’ll say it again. We must not build new, dangerous pipelines. The fight against pipelines that threaten our natural resources and our planet must continue.
author: BernieSanders

text: Congratulations, San Antonio. It is time for our entire country to ensure that every worker has access to paid family leave, paid sick time and paid vacations – just like they do in every other wealthy country on the planet.
author: BernieSanders

text: Shame on this administration and shame on anyone seeking to boot people off of Medicaid. Attacking the poor and people with disabilities is cowardly and despicable.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you, Orlando and Tampa. Let’s transform Florida and this nation on August 28th and make @AndrewGillum the next Governor of Florida. https://andrewgillum.com/

text: It's an honor to be in Tampa this morning to support @AndrewGillum to be the next Governor of Florida. Watch our rally live! https://www.facebook.com/andrewgillumfl/videos/2095289107455767/ …
author: BernieSanders

text: When we stand together as one people, united, fighting for a progressive agenda, there is nothing, nothing, nothing that we cannot accomplish.
author: BernieSanders

text: If every major country on earth can guarantee health care to all and achieve better health outcomes, while spending substantially less per capita than we do, it is absurd for anyone to suggest that the United States of America cannot do the same.
author: BernieSanders

text: When workers organize and stand together, they win. http://inthesetimes.com/working/entry/21386/militant_taxi_drivers_union_uber_lyft_alliance_new_york_city …
author: BernieSanders

text: Congratulations to Peter Welch who won his primary for US House, Dave Zuckerman for Lt Gov, Chris Pearson for State Senate, Mari Cordes, Susan Hatch Davis, Dennis LaBounty, Cindy Weed, Robin Chestnut-Tangerman and Martha Allen who all won their primaries for Vermont State House.
author: BernieSanders

text: I am very thankful to everyone who voted for my re-election to US Senate in the Vermont Democratic Primary. I am also proud to announce all 9 candidates I endorsed in Vermont won their primaries and that this primary had one of the largest turnouts in Vermont's history.
author: BernieSanders

text: Many of the ideas we’ve been talking about for years are now ideas that are mainstream ideas supported by the vast majority of the American people. Our vision, a vision of social justice, economic justice, racial justice, and environmental justice, will be the future of America.
author: BernieSanders

text: As I said last night on @colbertlateshow, people are sick and tired of the greed and power of a handful of people on top and they want a government which represents all of us, not just the 1%.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must end one party rule in Washington this November. I intend to do everything I can along with every other progressive in this nation between now and then to make sure that happens.
author: BernieSanders

text: This is why we must fight as hard as we can to stop the privatization of Medicaid, Medicare and Social Security. We cannot leave the life-saving care of millions of people in the hands of companies looking to make a big a profit as they can.
author: BernieSanders

text: Congratulations to @christineforvt for her Democratic primary win for Governor of Vermont tonight. Let's continue making history and win this November!
author: BernieSanders

text: Vermont - thanks so much for the strong support you’ve given me tonight.
author: BernieSanders

text: I’m excited to be on @colbertlateshow tonight! Tune in live at 11:35PM EST to join us.
author: BernieSanders

text: Something is very wrong when, last year, the top 25 hedge fund managers earned more than the combined income of 425,000 public school teachers. We have got to get our priorities right.
author: BernieSanders

text: I am so inspired by the Parkland students who are registering voters in communities with historically low turnout and hosting town halls to curb gun violence. Young people have the power to transform this nation.
author: BernieSanders

text: For Vermont State House, I am proud to have endorsed Susan Hatch Davis in Orange-1, Dennis LaBounty in Caledonia-4, Cindy Weed in Franklin-7, Mari Cordes in Addison-4, Robin Chestnut-Tangerman in Rutland-Bennington, and Martha Allen in Essex-Caledonia-Orleans-1.
author: BernieSanders

text: Today is Primary Day in Vermont! I appreciate your support and hope you will vote for my re-election to the US Senate. I am proud to support @PeterWelch for US House, @DaveZuckermanVT for LT Gov, and @SenatorCP for State Senate.
author: BernieSanders

text: Wall Street, billionaires, and corporations are organized and have led this massive redistribution of wealth to help the rich get even richer. It’s time for the working class to organize and fight back.
author: BernieSanders

text: Let me be clear: class warfare goes on in the United States right now. The richer are getting much richer, the poor are getting poorer, and the middle class is disappearing.
author: BernieSanders

text: We owe so much to the trade union movement. As often as not, the rights we often now take for granted were won through struggle by the trade union movement.
author: BernieSanders

text: We can honor Heather Heyer’s memory by standing up to all forms of oppression and bigotry in this country - racism, sexism, homophobia, xenophobia and religious intolerance. All of us must do our part in creating a just society.
author: BernieSanders

text: The next day, the white supremacists and Neo-Nazis marched again but this time thousands of protesters showed up to stand up to their hatred and bigotry. Countless people were injured standing up to hate and and one person, Heather Heyer, was killed.
author: BernieSanders

text: One year ago today, a few students with nothing but a “VA Students Act Against White Supremacy” banner courageously stood up to hundreds of white supremacists and Neo-Nazis who had them surrounded while marching in defense of a Confederate statue in Charlottesville.
author: BernieSanders

text: Without struggle, there is no progress. It was truly an honor to stand with @AdyBarkan today across Vermont to stand up for health care and our nation.
author: BernieSanders

text: We need to invest in our children, in our elderly, and in healthcare and education and environmental protection. People are sick and tired of spending billions and billions of dollars on nuclear weapons, war planes, missiles, bombs, and tanks.
author: BernieSanders

text: I also want to congratulate @JamesThompsonKS, Wesley Bell in Missouri, and @RashidaTlaib in Michigan. Their victories are important milestones for this nation. The struggle continues.
author: BernieSanders

text: Making a political revolution is not easy, and we should be enormously proud of the progress we are making across the country. @AbdulElSayed & @BrentWelder ran in what we knew from the start would be difficult races, and advanced the progressive cause in very significant ways.
author: BernieSanders

text: The Trump administration continues to lead a rapid shift towards oligarchy. We must have the courage to stand up and take on the powerful who only ever want more and more for themselves like Wilbur Ross.
author: BernieSanders

text: I’m excited and honored to do 3 events across Vermont tomorrow with @AdyBarkan. Please join us tomorrow to stand up for health care, raising the minimum wage, paid family leave, racial justice, and our country! http://www.radvt.org/ady_hero
author: BernieSanders

text: Political and social revolutions that attempt to transform our society never end. They continue every day, every week and every month in the fight to create a nation of social and economic justice.
author: BernieSanders

text: How tragic it is that today, while hundreds of millions of people live in abysmal poverty, the arms merchants of the world grow increasingly rich as governments spend trillions of dollars on weapons of destruction.
author: BernieSanders

text: I’m glad to hear that a federal judge in New Orleans has ruled that the city's cash bail system is unconstitutional. Our destructive and unjust cash bail process is part of our broken criminal justice system – and must be ended.
author: BernieSanders

text: We are not going back to the days when women had to risk their lives to end an unwanted pregnancy. Brett Kavanaugh’s nomination for Supreme Court justice must be rejected. #SaveRoe

text: Congratulations to @JamesThompsonKS on his Democratic primary victory last night in Kansas. Let’s flip the 4th Congressional district in Kansas this November!
author: BernieSanders

text: I'm glad to hear Prop A was defeated tonight in Missouri. Right-to-work legislation must be defeated nationwide. We must stand together, beat back union busters, and continue to build and grow the trade union movement in this country.
author: BernieSanders

text: Please read this article about the incredible life and activism of my friend, @AdyBarkan. I’m honored to be doing 3 events with him this Friday across Vermont.
author: BernieSanders

text: Secretary DeVos has made it clear this administration works for the executives and shareholders of predatory for-profit colleges rather than with students and taxpayers.
author: BernieSanders

author: BernieSanders

text: Robust universal programs build solidarity, and create an impassioned base who enthusiastically defend them. We can do the same with Medicare for All.

text: We must end the use of cash bail in federal courts and work with state and local governments to end this broken and destructive system in every area of the country.
author: BernieSanders

text: Tomorrow, August 7th, let’s beat back the attacks on unions and #VoteNoOnPropA in Missouri. We must put public interest before corporate interests and defeat right-to-work legislation in every state.
author: BernieSanders

text: I’m so excited and honored to announce I’ll be doing 3 events with a great progressive leader this Friday in Vermont. Please join me and a true champion for health care and economic security @AdyBarkan for events in Brattleboro, Bennington, and Bristol! http://www.radvt.org/ady_hero
author: BernieSanders

text: All across this nation, people are standing together to transform our economic and political system and standing up to the Trump administration's efforts to divide us up.

text: On August 7th, let's show Michigan and this nation what is possible and elect @AbdulElSayed to be the next Governor of Michigan.
author: BernieSanders

text: It looks like Michigan is ready to make history this Tuesday by voting for @AbdulElSayed to be its next Governor. Let's do everything we can in the next few days to create a historic victory! https://abdulformichigan.com/

text: It’s an honor to be in Michigan today to support @AbdulElSayed for Governor of Michigan. Watch our Detroit rally live!
author: BernieSanders

text: It’s no surprise the Trump administration lied to the American people yet again. In cynically declaring the War on Poverty a success, the Trump administration has been attempting to justify its ongoing attacks on poor people.
author: BernieSanders

text: A great nation is judged not by how many millionaires and billionaires it has, but by how it treats the weakest and most vulnerable amongst us.
author: BernieSanders

text: New polling shows there are no small number of progressive economic policies that a large majority of working people are ready to rally around. Our ideas are popular. We need the political will to fight for them at the local and national level.
author: BernieSanders

text: If we are serious about transforming our country, if we are serious about reinvigorating our democracy, we need to develop a political movement which, once again, is prepared to take on and defeat a ruling class whose greed is destroying our nation.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must combat cynicism, fear and despair. We must reverse the drift toward oligarchy, and create a government which represents all the people and not just the few.
author: BernieSanders

text: Medicare for all would not only guarantee health care for all people, not only save families and our entire nation significant sums of money, it would radically improve the lives of all Americans and bring about significant improvements in our economy.
author: BernieSanders

text: Real freedom must include economic security. People are not truly free when they are unable to feed their family, when they’re unable to retire with dignity, when they have no health care. It is a vision that we have not yet achieved. It is time that we did.
author: BernieSanders

text: When the labor movement in Missouri defeats Prop A on August 7th, their victory will show the nation how to defeat anti-worker legislation like right-to-work at the state level and how much power there is in a union.

text: A 2017 study done by @EconomicPolicy showed that 54% of American workers are threatened with loss of their job if they voted to unionize. We must empower workers and make it easier to unionize.

text: If we are serious about reforming the tax code and rebuilding the middle class, we have got to demand that the wealthiest Americans and largest corporations pay their fair share in taxes.
author: BernieSanders

text: In the richest nation in the history of the world, it's a moral and political failing that we still have tens of millions of people living in poverty. We must demand change and raise the standard of living for everyone in this country so nobody is living in poverty.
author: BernieSanders

text: Medicare for all is an idea that's time has come. In this pivotal moment in American history, we must go forward to guarantee health care as a right and not a privilege.
author: BernieSanders

text: Democracy is not a spectator sport. At this moment in history, when there is so much political alienation and despair, it is absolutely imperative that we keep hope alive and get millions of new people involved in our political processes to shape our future.
author: BernieSanders

text: It was an honor celebrate the role that Vermont's labor unions have played in winning justice for working people this past weekend in Burlington.
author: BernieSanders

text: The status quo doesn’t work. Period. We need to create a Medicare for all universal health care system that guarantees health care to all people.
author: BernieSanders

text: Democracy means one person one vote, not billionaires buying elections. We need to #FixDemocracyNow by overturning Citizens United, moving toward public funding of elections, and ending voter suppression.
author: BernieSanders

text: Medicare for all is an idea that's time has come. Make a donation -- of any amount -- to my re-election and to help me support progressive candidates across the country and we'll send you a Medicare for all sticker to show your support.
author: BernieSanders

text: Our vision for American democracy should be a nation in which all people, regardless of their income, can participate in the political process, can run for office without begging for contributions from the wealthy and the powerful.
author: BernieSanders

text: When we talk about our responsibilities as human beings and as parents, there is nothing more important than leaving our planet healthy and habitable for our kids and our grandkids.
author: BernieSanders

text: Andrew has never backed down from a fight, including beating the NRA and standing up against xenophobic politicians. @AndrewGillum will set a new course for Florida — a governor who represents all the people and not just powerful special interests.
author: BernieSanders

text: As governor, @AndrewGillum will work to provide health care for all through a Medicare-for-All program, raise the minimum wage, invest in sustainable energy, improve education, make sure the wealthiest corporations pay their fair share of taxes, and be welcoming to immigrants.

text: I’m proud to endorse Tallahassee Mayor @AndrewGillum in his race for governor of Florida.
author: BernieSanders

text: Change happens when millions of people stand up and demand it. Women’s rights, civil rights, LGBTQ rights, and workers’ rights were all advanced through collective struggle.

text: This is class warfare, plain and simple.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must take on the fossil fuel industry, accelerate our transition to clean energy, and finally put people before the profits of polluters.
author: BernieSanders

text: 63% of American voters support a single-payer Medicare for All system. It's more popular now than ever before. Those who say this goal is unachievable are selling the American people short. https://jacobinmag.com/2018/07/medicare-for-all-savings-mercatus-center-report …
author: BernieSanders

text: We must act boldly to move our energy system away from fossil fuels, toward energy efficiency and sustainable energy sources like wind, solar, and geothermal because we have a moral responsibility to leave our kids a planet that is healthy and habitable.
author: BernieSanders

author: BernieSanders

author: BernieSanders

text: The labor movement is my family and unions built this nation.  I'm honored to be with everyone tonight at the Vermont Workers' Appreciation Dinner.

text: It is imperative that we have the courage to stand with the poor, to stand with working people and when necessary, take on very powerful and wealthy people whose greed is doing this country and planet enormous harm.

text: When we talk about justice, we have to understand that there is no justice when so few have so much and so many have so little. There is no justice when the top one-tenth of 1 percent today in America owns almost as much wealth as the bottom 90 percent.

text: It is appalling but not surprising that Sec. DeVos has proposed a new “borrower defense” rule that favors her friends in the for-profit college industry rather than students and taxpayers.

text: Don't let anyone tell you otherwise. We are making progress in the fight for a $15 minimum wage, healthcare for all and free tuition at public colleges and universities. The struggle continues.

text: The millennial generation is the most progressive generation in the history of the United States. It was great to speak tonight at the Tumble Down Festival in Burlington, Vermont!
author: BernieSanders

text: -@AbdulElSayed has stood with the people his entire life, now it's our time to stand with him and his campaign for Governor of Michigan. Please join in donating to his campaign so we can transform Michigan and transform this country.
author: BernieSanders

text: It is time to end Wall Street's stranglehold on Puerto Rico's future, return control of the island to the people of Puerto Rico and give the territory the debt relief it so desperately needs to rebuild with dignity.
author: BernieSanders

text: It has always been clear that we have separate criminal justice systems in this country for the poor and for the rich.  Our destructive and unjust cash bail process is part of our broken criminal justice system – and must be ended.
author: BernieSanders

text: Under @AbdulElSayed's leadership Michigan can help lead the nation in guaranteeing health care for all through a Medicare for All single-payer type system, tuition-free public colleges and universities; a minimum wage of $15 per hour and strong environmental protections.

text: I’m proud to endorse @AbdulElSayed for Governor of Michigan. As governor, Dr. El-Sayed will fight for a government in Lansing that represents all the people, and not just wealthy special interests.
author: BernieSanders

text: We must challenge the politics of austerity and the politics of increasing the gap between the richest and the poorest. We can’t afford this level of inequality if we’re to have justice in our society.
author: BernieSanders

text: There is a reason why big money interests are getting nervous and that's because many of our progressive ideas are now backed by the majority of the American public and we are making real progress in transforming the nation.

text: Trump and the Republicans sold the American people yet another lie. They said their tax cuts were supposed to boost wages for workers. They haven’t. It merely helped the rich get even richer.

text: If we can get @JamesThompsonKS and @BrentWelder elected to Congress, these will be elections that will be heard not only all over this country but all over the world.
author: BernieSanders

text: Brett Kavanaugh’s nomination for Supreme Court justice must be rejected and his far right agenda is completely out of touch with what Americans want. We are not going back to the days when women had to risk their lives to end an unwanted pregnancy.
author: BernieSanders

text: This is the wealthiest nation that has ever existed on the face of this planet. It has abundant wealth beyond all of our imaginations. It has the power to cure this country of its economic and social ills if we have the political will to do so.
author: BernieSanders

text: All across this nation, people are standing up and fighting back against partisan gerrymandering. I applaud the thousands and thousands of activists nationwide who are leading ballot measure efforts for fair maps at the state level.
author: BernieSanders

text: I am so inspired by the young people in Florida who are getting their generation involved in the political process. This is an example that must be followed all across the country. Please register to vote and help transform this nation!

text: The Democratic Party must open its doors, bring new people in, and once again be the party that represents working people, not just the one percent.
author: BernieSanders

text: Our job is to energize the American people and to transform the country. I am so thankful to all of you that are in that struggle with me in Kansas, Vermont and all across the nation.
author: BernieSanders

text: People told me Kansas was a Republican state. It doesn’t look like it.
author: BernieSanders

text: It's not Bernie, it's you, and it's us. We all must do our job in waging the political revolution.
author: BernieSanders

text: Whether you live in Kansas or Vermont or NYC, you know that health care is a human right.
author: BernieSanders

text: I don’t believe there are red states or blue states. Any state in this country where there are people struggling is a state that is prepared to fight for justice.
author: BernieSanders

text: Together we're going to make history. We're going to elect @BrentWelder to represent the 3rd Congressional district in Kansas.
author: BernieSanders

text: “We here tonight still know that Kansas populism is alive and well.” - @BrentWelder
author: BernieSanders

text: It's a very packed house in Kansas City tonight for my rally with @Ocasio2018 in support of @BrentWelder for Congress! The issues we fight for are not just popular in Vermont, Queens and the Bronx, they are popular everywhere.
author: BernieSanders

text: Hello from Kansas City where we’re doing everything we can to turn Kansas blue. – bei Jack Reardon Civic Center
author: BernieSanders

text: It's an honor to be in Wichita today with @Ocasio2018 to support @JamesThompsonKS for Congress and to see so many people in Kansas energized and ready for progressive change. Watch our rally live!
author: BernieSanders

text: Peter Welch has been a progressive leader in Congress in fighting against the outrageously high cost of prescription drugs, standing up for Vermont farmers and understanding that health care is a right, not a privilege. I am happy to support @PeterWelch in his re-election effort.
author: BernieSanders

text: We live in a time of ruthless domination and subjection from above. We must take on the billionaire class and fight for a society that works for all of us, and not just the privileged few.
author: BernieSanders

text: What we fight for is not just popular in Vermont, Queens and the Bronx, it’s popular everywhere. I’m excited to rally in support of @JamesThompsonKS with @Ocasio2018 this Friday in a venue that’s now much larger than we had originally planned for!
author: BernieSanders

text: We are seeing progressive ideas that a few years ago were considered to be radical and extreme and fringe, suddenly becoming mainstream - because working people from coast to coast are standing up and fighting for them.
author: BernieSanders

text: This week I’m traveling to Kansas with @Ocasio2018 to rally in support of @JamesThompsonKS and @BrentWelder for Congress — two great progressive candidates who will prove our message can win anywhere.
author: BernieSanders

text: I'm honored to be endorsed by @RightsVT for my U.S. Senate re-election campaign. Together we'll improve the lives of Vermonters by working to raise the minimum wage, expanding workers’ rights, and fighting for universal health care and racial equity.
author: BernieSanders

text: If we believe in democracy, it’s not just voting every four years, or every two years—it’s about empowering your whole life and having more say in what you do all day.
author: BernieSanders

text: It was great to support @EllisonCampaign in Minnesota, @tammybaldwin and @IronStache in Wisconsin, and @JohnFetterman in Pennsylvania this weekend and to see thousands and thousands of people across the country ready to work for progressive change.

text: I had the pleasure of meeting with two great political revolutionaries @SummerForPA and @Innamo - newly elected members to the Pennsylvania State House.
author: BernieSanders

text: It's an honor to be standing with @Innamo @SummerForPA and @JohnFetterman today in Pittsburgh. Watch our rally live! https://www.facebook.com/pg/JohnFettermanPA/videos/ …
author: BernieSanders

text: When we are prepared to get involved in the political process, to fight for a progressive agenda, to run for office, to support progressive candidates, there is no end to what we can accomplish for our great country.
author: BernieSanders

text: If Trump can give billionaires tax breaks, yes, we can substantially lower student debt in this country.
author: BernieSanders

text: It is great to be supporting @tammybaldwin this morning in Eau Claire and seeing so many people energized for real change across Wisconsin! Watch our rally live: https://www.facebook.com/TammyBaldwin/videos/10157560099196102/ …
author: BernieSanders

text: Do not despair and give into cynicism. Another world is possible and together we can transform our political system.

text: I extend my thanks and stand in solidarity with the many Vermonters who marched tonight in support of the striking @VFNHP nurses. We must continue to advocate for an equitable and fair contract for the nurses. #RedForMed
author: BernieSanders

text:
Please remember that the Supreme Court has huge consequences on our lives:

- Millions do not have Medicaid today because of the Supreme Court.
- Billionaires can buy elections because of the Supreme Court.

We must do everything we can to defeat Brett Kavanaugh’s nomination.
author: BernieSanders

text: It has been truly inspiring to see so many people energized for @EllisonCampaign today across Minnesota!
author: BernieSanders

text: It was an honor to share the stage with you today, Ady. You are an inspiration.
author: BernieSanders

text: It is past time for @VFNHP nurses to be compensated and treated fairly. Join us in supporting the nurses for a march from the hospital to City Hall Park at 5:30PM tonight! #RedForMed http://inthesetimes.com/working/entry/21299/vermont_nurses_bernie_sanders_union_red_for_med …
author: BernieSanders

text: As Minnesota Attorney General, @EllisonCampaign will be the People’s Attorney and he'll fight to protect the most vulnerable among us. It was an absolute honor to stand with him today in Minneapolis.
author: BernieSanders

text: When Minnesotans go toe-to-toe with powerful, connected, and moneyed interests, they deserve a champion. That’s why I’m proud to be supporting @EllisonCampaign for Minnesota Attorney General. Watch our Minneapolis rally live!
author: BernieSanders

text: Solidarity with @VFNHP nurses who went on strike this morning. Nurses are the backbone of a moral and just society and they deserve fair wages.
author: BernieSanders

text: This weekend I’m so proud to be standing with @tammybaldwin and @IronStache in Wisconsin, @EllisonCampaign in Minnesota, and @JohnFetterman in Pennsylvania. Every day in office they’ll fight for the public interest, not corporate interest. They'll represent the many, not the few.
author: BernieSanders

text: Don’t let anyone tell you otherwise. We are making real progress. We are transforming American politics.
author: BernieSanders

text: It is the people, in open primaries and caucuses, who should determine the Democratic nominee for president - not well-connected "super-delegates." This is an important step forward in making the Democratic Party more democratic and transparent.
author: BernieSanders

text: If Brett Kavanaugh is confirmed to the Supreme Court it will have a profoundly negative effect on workers' rights, women's rights and voting rights for decades to come. We must do everything we can to stop this nomination.
author: BernieSanders

text:
In the 2014 midterm elections only 37% of Americans voted. We now have a  reactionary Congress in slavish support of wealthy campaign contributors, making devastating attacks against working families.

Democracy is not a spectator sport. Register to vote. Get involved.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you to everyone who joined us, and happy Independence Day!
author: BernieSanders

text: Spending a day walking in parades, meeting with volunteers, speaking to supporters and Vermonters, and enjoying the beautiful Vermont weather was a great pleasure. I look forward to many more like it this summer.
author: BernieSanders

text: Today, I visited the towns of Warren, Rochester, and Bristol.
author: BernieSanders

text: Thank you to all the supporters and volunteers who joined me in yesterday's Independence Day Parade in Montpelier. Meeting and talking to the people of Vermont is the best part of campaigning, and I look forward to seeing many more of you between now and November.
author: BernieSanders

text: Congratulations to @lopezobrador_ and the people of Mexico. Our countries must work together to create a continent which creates economic, social, racial and environmental justice instead of divisiveness and xenophobia.
author: BernieSanders

text: I want to thank all the supporters, volunteers, and Vermonters who joined us Saturday in Waterbury for their annual Independence Day Parade.
author: BernieSanders

text: In a nation where corporate media defines what's "acceptable," voter turnout lags behind almost every major nation and billionaires can buy elections, our job is to open the doors of democracy and elect candidates who support economic, social, racial and environmental justice.
author: BernieSanders

text: This is what the political revolution is all about. All across this country working people and young people are getting involved in the political process, running grassroots campaigns, taking on the establishment and winning elections.
author: BernieSanders

text: I was very pleased to join friends, supporters, volunteers, and the people of the Northeast Kingdom at Newport’s Centennial Celebration earlier today. Thank you to the city of Newport for the kind invitation and warm reception.

text:
Recently, Disney CEO Bob Iger did the right thing and cancelled Roseanne after her racist tweet. 

I say to Mr. Iger: you have another opportunity to lead. Stand with working families by paying all your employees a living wage and making health care a right, not a privilege.
author: BernieSanders

text: In the year 2018, no one in America, especially those working for a profitable corporation like Disney, should be homeless or not be able to feed their families. #StopDisneyPoverty
author: BernieSanders

text:
You want to know what is radical? A company like Disney that makes $9 billion in profits while nearly 75% of its workers at Disneyland can’t cover their monthly living expenses.

Paying your workers a living wage is not a radical idea.
author: BernieSanders

text:
We are here at Disneyland to say loudly and clearly to the CEO of Disney: Pay your workers a living wage, not a poverty wage! Your greed must end.

Watch our live town hall: https://www.facebook.com/berniesanders/posts/1784064581648538 …
author: BernieSanders

text:
While Disney’s CEO makes up to $423 million:

- 1 in 10 Disneyland workers have been homeless in the past 2 years
- More than 2 in 3 are food insecure
- 3 in 4 don’t make enough money to afford basic needs

This isn’t what Mickey Mouse and Donald Duck are supposed to be about.
author: BernieSanders

text: Mueller's indictment provides further evidence that the Russian government interfered in 2016. It also shows that they tried to turn my supporters against Hillary Clinton in the primary and general election. I unequivocally condemn such interference.
author: BernieSanders

text:
The key issues now are: 

1) How we prevent the unwitting manipulation of our electoral and political system by foreign governments.
2) Exposing who was actively consorting with the Russian government’s attack on our democracy.
author: BernieSanders

text: As someone who campaigned hard for Hillary Clinton from one end of this country to another, it is an outrage that she had to run against not only Donald Trump but also the Russian government.

text: What the Russians did in the 2016 election cycle deserves unconditional condemnation. That includes all of their conduct - whether it was active support of any candidate or active opposition to any candidate.

text: It is absolutely imperative that the Mueller investigation be allowed to go forward without obstruction from the Trump administration or Congress.
